characters: THE KNIFE SINKS DEEP INTO LOEB'S EYE.
PAINT, SAW, TIN SNIPS, RAZORS, DUCT TAPE, INDUSTRIAL GLUE
THE WORDS ARE A REVELATION TO BRUCE.
INT. GORDON'S CRAPPY CAR. EAST END
INT GOTHAM JUSTICE BUILDING. LOEB'S OFFICE
INT WOMEN'S BATHROOM. THE COMET LOUNGE

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOTHAM CITY, NIGHT
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING RIPS across a jet-black SKY.   THUNDER CRASHES. LIGHTNING casts GOTHAM CITY in stark relief.  SIRENS WAIL CAR ALARMS SCREAM.  A CACOPHONY. LIGHTNING SILHOUETTES a menacing POLICE HELICOPTER, ROARI downward like a monster insect. LIGHTNING... SPARK? SHOWER. WILD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sweating, tormented sleeper В— BRUCE WAYNE. His eyes hollowed, skin pale, he TOSSES and TURNS.  Then FLINCHES. 3 more times he В—

dialogues.speaker: FLINCHES
dialogues.text: FLINCHES. Then В— His EYES pop open WIDE

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE WAYNE SCREAMS
dialogues.text: It is the sound of INCOMPREHENSIBLE HORROR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awoken from his NIGHTMARE by the sound of his own scream, disoriented, BRUCE goes to the sink and SPLASHES cold wat in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father. WHERE are you? What will I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hands tremble. Distant THUNDER sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL, a gigantic, early middle-aged black man carrie bag of doughnuts and two coffees. He whistles as he walks through a run-down slum. He stops and inserts a key at a grimy storefront: The sig reads, AL and Son, Repair, Service, Salvage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL hits the lights revealing a meticulously clean auto repair shop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce? Bruce? You here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL continues his search in theВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a dreary, dirty, isolated place. Its sole occupant, BRUCE, loads large car parts onto a flatbed TRUCK bearing the 'AL and Son' logo. He carries the heavy transmissions and engine blocks on h broad, muscular shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning sunshine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE says nothing, he just STARES at LITTLE AL with troubled, tired eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Hands BRUCE a coffee) OK twinkle toes. Let's take a look    at the job orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two head up a wooden staircase over the garage and en

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the claustrophobic room of an obsessive compulsive. Neatly organized electronic hobby projects line the walls POLICE SCANNERS, RADIOS and TVs.  Their readouts and disp provide the only light. LITTLE AL opens the blackout curtains. Sunlight pours in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opens a ledger) So the load on the truck is the DiMotto order, right? (BRUCE nods) You finished the rebuild on that caddie, and the tranny for Spencer. (BRUCE nods some more) I guess that's it, huh? You know I COULD put in a couple days, help you out down here, if you want a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL looks at BRUCE's pale skin and sunken eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIG AL would kick my butt if he saw you now. You look terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL puts his hand on BRUCE's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those pills aren't working, are they, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nightmares stopped then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE doesn't speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you just need to air yourself out a little bit.  Go the park.  Go to the beach.  Find yourself a girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated) ) Yeah, fine. Right  Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL hands BRUCE a wad of bills

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, a man can't keep cooped up in one place all the time. He's got to keep moving, like a shark, moving, moving, moving, or he dies. You can't stay stuck in one place, Bruce  It just ain't HEALTHY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL leaves. As BRUCE closes the blackout curtain, his gaze lingers ac the street on the girls galore peepshow theater.  From th looks of it, the sleazy sex venue was once a GRAND THEATR But now, on top of its classic, old-world facade, a pink plastic sign promises 'GIRLS, GIRLS, GIRLS.' Out front, prostitutes offer their wares. CHI-CHI, a young PIMP with long, greasy hair and felt bel bottoms, SLAPS a fat whore, she CRIES and APOLOGIZES. Other whores usher men into a brownstone CATHOUSE next do BRUCE's gaze travels to a window directly across from his Inside the CATHOUSE, a long, lean black woman, SELINA, pu handcuffs on a skinny man. She wears tight fitting, black leather. SELINA notices BRUCE and gives him a playful wave. He clo the curtains. Leaving us alone in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE sits and writes a letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: September 4. Dear Father, I am still confused. What are you trying to tell me? What do you want from me? Please, I don't understand. Your son, Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finished, BRUCE puts the letter in an ENVELOPE. Then, get and goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNDER rolls on the night air. In the sweaty palm of JAMES GORDON rest six bullets. GORD sits in his boxers on the toilet. In his mouth he holds h SERVICE REVOLVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, come to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON looks up at the door. He puts the gun, with its we barrel, into a holster with a badge clipped to the side a leaves the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard time sleeping again, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear bedsprings sag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON gets off the elevator and walks through the busy precinct room full of COPS. As he passes, CONVERSATIONS STOP. Men with shoulder holsters and badges on their hip watch GORDON with obvious disdain. GORDON puts his lunch in his desk and flips through paper He lights a MARLBORO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign reads "Evidence Room". A YOUNG COP stares at GORDO with bad intent through a Plexiglas window. GORDON puts papers in the pass-through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for the Irwin case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The YOUNG COP doesn't say a word. As GORDON leaves, he passes the door to the evidence room It's half open. We catch a quick glimpse insideВ— two detectives stuff YELLOW ENVELOPES and stack BILLS --before the door SLAMS shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON stands at a URINAL as DETECTIVE FLASS, about 40, b crew cut, enters

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got something for you Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Flass, I told you, I just don't want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, Jimmy, Jimmy, you're going to have to learn what it takes to be a cop in this town

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes the guys nervous when someone doesn't participate. They think you might say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like that, I just don't need the money. Maybe if I had kids like the other guys, or had trouble making ends meet it would be different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are saying, 'maybe he thinks he's better than we are. Maybe he thinks he's superior.' Is that how it is Jimmy? You think you're some kind of saint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's nothing like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're not a saint, Gordon. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just a cop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right, you're one of us

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASS jams a yellow envelope into GORDON'S hand and leave GORDON CRUSHES the YELLOW ENVELOPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASS jokes around the water cooler with a couple COPS. Then, back at his desk he sees the YELLOW ENVELOPE spiked his message post. FLASS registers a look of concern. FLASS' partner DETECTIVE CAMPBELL, a fat cop in a wrinkle suit, slaps him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we'll deal with him later. We got to make our rounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Together they leave and weВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE carries a brown paper grocery bag in his arms. THE WHORES do their thing: waving at cars, posing, vampin They see BRUCE in his BLUE JUMPSUIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there garage boy! Want to look under my hood, check my fluid levels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can top me off anytime!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The youngest prostitute, HOLLY, joins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show you why they say, "good things come in small packages?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLY! GET OVER HERE! He's a neighbor, not a John. And the rest of you, cut it out. You got nothing better to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like making me some MONEY. Get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHI-CHI is interrupted by the honk of a horn. DETECTIVE FLASS sits behind the wheel of an UNMARKED COP with a Ballantine Ale on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there CHI-CHI. How's business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to him in the car sits DETECTIVE CAMPBELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing, to CHI-CHI) Hey, you know what, you're the only HIPPY PIMP I ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got something for us Greaseball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Here you guys go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHI-CHI passes a YELLOW ENVELOPE through the window to FL FLASS flips through the bills inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This it, Flowerpower?  Looks kind of light to me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the same as last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, you seem to be doing pretty good for yourself. Maybe it's time we talk to ESTRADA,  REEVALUATE our arrangement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe SELINA can throw in a little dark meat to make up the balance. How about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. SELINA, get over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA reluctantly approaches the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give DETECTIVE CAMPBELL a date on the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can put away the toys, sweet thing. I'll show you how a REAL MAN does it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. You're not coming anywhere near me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to walk away but CHI-CHI grabs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Classic. One can't get his whores to screw, the other can't get screwed by a whore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASS pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have time for this. Got to keep moving. More pick-ups to   make before quitting time. Ta-ta ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASS waves his BEER CAN farewell as he drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that? You made me LOOK BAD.  I got a REP to maintain.  I look weak, then scumbag crooked cops take advantage, try to push me around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the rules  Nothing for Free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA jerks her arm free and storms off. But CHI-CHI grabs her again and SPINS HER AROUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe it's time we RE-EVALUATE the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly CHI-CHI is aware that BRUCE stands very close glowering at the pimp. PURE UNHOLY HATRED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck you want, retard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHI-CHI flicks open his SWITCH BLADE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to CHI-CHI) Leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHI-CHI backhands her across the mouth. BRUCE, oblivious to the knife, moves to take out CHI-CHI. But SELINA catches BRUCE's eye and, WITHOUT SAYING A WORD tells BRUCE to "let it go". BRUCE just turns and walks awayВ— an obedient soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought.   WIMP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selina watches BRUCE march back intoВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE KICKS open the doorВ— FLINGS groceries everywhereВ— PUNCHES the plaster wallВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: September 17. Father, it takes everything I have just to contain this fury.  I can feel it in my chest.  It wants to ESCAPE. I'm AFRAID of what I might do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL is in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going in here. You OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE tries to push past LITTLE AL and out of the garage. LITTLE AL grabs his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do YOU want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you give me lip, boy. I know what you're going through. You can't hide it from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know ANYTHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  I've got something for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL pushes aside a work bench, digs out a key and o a dirty, disused door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father's office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL says nothing. The two men go insideВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a tomb. Dusty, unused and preserved. LITTLE AL at the desk and starts opening drawers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking) Sit down Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE sits on a dusty chair. LITTLE AL finds what he's looking for, shoe-box. He turns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Bruce, BIG AL worked HARD to put me through med school. He dreamed of giving me more than that garage. But he NEVER said a WORD after the war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He understood what happens to a man who's SEEN too much of this world's evil.  Do you know what I'm talking about Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we found you out in the scrap pile you were scared, more of a wild animal than a boy, really. And you had something with you, do you remember that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE says 'Yes' with his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) You wouldn't let it go... Took BIG AL three months to even get a look at it. You cried for weeks when he took it from you. He said you weren't ready to have it.  You called it your INHERITANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL puts a hand on BRUCE's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When BIG AL was up in that hospital, he asked me watch over you, made me promise, and I have.  You're like my boy, Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL gives BRUCE's shoulder a squeeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now you're scaring me.  There's something going on in your head, and while I can't say I know exactly what it is, I can tell you this: A man has got to know who he is before he can confront his demons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL open the shoe box and removes a smaller WOODEN with a heavy brass latch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe your INHERITANCE can help you figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL places the WOODEN BOX on BRUCE'S knee. BRUCE just stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not ready yet, huh' I understand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL stands up and waits. After a moment BRUCE stand and they both walk back intoВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL locks the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take all the time you want. It's late. I'm going home. I hope you can find some comfort in this, Bruce. Sleep well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL leaves BRUCE staring at the WOODEN BOX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE writes another letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: September 22. Dear Father, I almost slipped today. God help me if I lose control. Little Al gave me back my inheritance. What should I do with it? Please tell me.  I don't know how much longer I can go without your help. Please send instructions. Your loving son, Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE signs the letter and puts it in an ENVELOPE. Puts a stamp on the envelope. BRUCE gets ready for bed and turns in. He doesn't sleep, stares at the WOODEN BOX from his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA's apartment is painted to look like a dungeon. The tools of her trade line the wallsВ— WHIPS, CUFFS, A CRICK BAT FOR SPANKING. CATS lounge all over the place. HOLLY sits cross-legged in an electric chair. She paints toe nails and watches SELINA pace the cramped room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There has to be more to it than this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIFE! Jesus, there has GOT to be more out there than just PIMPS and JOHNS. We spend our lives on our backs shuttling money from one to the other, FOR WHAT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing! Don't you see, we're being used. We're stuck here and for all our work, we have nothing. While they're getting rich.  I'm sick of it, I'm not going to take it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? Run off? Marry a John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HA! Have you seen the guys who come here for my services? Shit. What I'd give to meet a real man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) Got to go. My 10:30 should be here. (at the door) You know, maybe there are no real men. Maybe the whole world IS just PIMPS and JOHNS. Ever think of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLY leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self) Then I'll have to find my own way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her door.  And weВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the steps of a magical old-world movie palace. I bright,  clean, hyper-realВ— a dream. A BOY, about 8, leaves a showing of Zorro with his MOTHER FATHER. He goofs around with an imaginary sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: En guard! En guard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Her best Fay Rae imitation.) Oh Brave Zorro, Save us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but can Zorro fly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FATHER grabs his BOY and throws him in the air. The BOY freaks out with laughter. The BOY is caught under his arms and again tossed upwards and into a В—

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTMARE
dialogues.text: The sky darkens. The boy registers FEAR and fallsВ— - falls - - falls - - and SLAMS HARD onto a grimy sidewalk puddled with BLOOD His parents STRUGGLE with a MUGGER in the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from her you monster

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUGGER shoves FATHER back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slaps at MUGGER) No! Get off me. You can't have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUGGER grabs MOTHER VICIOUSLY by the THROAT and she's choking. PEARLS bounce on the pavement. FATHER takes a swing at the MUGGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy bastards.

dialogues.speaker: BOY FLINCHES.
dialogues.text: Blood sprays on his face.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: BRUCE WAYNE's body FLINCHES in his cot with each shot. We're back inВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE shoots upright in bed. BRUCE WAYNE'S MOUTH SNARLS, in torment. BRUCE WAYNE'S FISTS lay in his lap.  The fists QUAKE.  UN RAGE. He goes and takes the WOODEN BOX in his shaking, sweaty hands. His thumb is about to open the heavy brass latch B is interrupted by a clanking sound from the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sleazy sex venue wasВ— THE GRAND THEATER FROM BRUCE'S NIGHTMARES. Only now, instead of a young BOY walking the sidewalk wit his parentsВ— CAMPBELL, the fat detective, staggers around in the stree DRUNKENLY he throws a RUSTY MUFFLER up at SELINA'S WINDOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rapunzel, Rapunzel, let down your hair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her window opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You picked a BAD night to mess with me, CAMPBELL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aww, come on darling is that anyway to treat a customer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm paid up. You got your damn money. That's all you get from me, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA SLAMS her window. CAMPBELL takes a PULL from his BOTTLE And goes into the CATHOUSE. A moment later BRUCE crosses the street and follows him inside theВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE cautiously enters. From upstairsВ— Bang, bang, bang. He hears the sound of a fist pounding a door. Voices echo down the empty stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on honey, you know that's not the way things work. It's just part of the price of doing business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away you fat pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? Who are you? You're a WHORE. This is what you DO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE puts a foot on the first step up to В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMPBELL KICKS IN the doorВ— CRACK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (backs away) You can't do this. I pay you. I've always paid you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMPBELL grabs SELINA 'S WRIST. SELINA kicks him in the crotch В— THWACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BITCH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMPBELL SLAPS HER across the face, HARD. She CRASHES into a table covered with LEATHER BONDS, RUBB GEAR. MASKS. CATS scamper in all directions. SELINA SCRAMBLES for the door. CAMPBELL JERKS her back into the room and SLAMS her again the wall. SELINA punches CAMPBELL В— POP В— in the face. CAMPBELL'S head snaps back and SELINA makes a break for t door. He puts a hand to his face and feels the blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fucking dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENRAGED, CAMPBELL moves to block SELINA's escape. He punc her in the stomach. She collapses. CAMPBELL picks up her CRICKET BAT and starts smashing the place. SMACK В— a lamp flies into the wall. BASH В— a mus explodes into a million pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had it up to here with all the bitches like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMPBELL is standing over SELINA now, CRICKET BAT in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to show you once and for all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA is TERRIFIED! CAMPBELL bends down and GRABS SELINA VICIOUSLY by the THR andВ— LIFTS HER OFF THE GROUND with one hand. She is CHOKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mine to do with as I please, you understand that? And now it's going to please me to KILL YOU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cocks the CRICKET BAT back, about to smash her brains whenВ— SUDDENLY BRUCE APPEARS IN THE ROOM. HIS FACE: a mask of UNHOLY RAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you want? Get the hell out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE doesn't say a word. He just delivers an upper cut В SMACK В— to CAMPBELL'S rib cage. A couple ribs go. A left hookВ— SMACK В— to CAMPBELL'S face.  The nose shat An elbow В— SMACK В— to CAMPBELL'S head. The jaw breaks. CAMPBELL stumbles back to the wall. FALLS to his knees. BRUCE isn't finished with CAMPBELL. He moves in. SELINA grabs the cricket batВ—

dialogues.speaker: SHE HITS BRUCE
dialogues.text: A startled BRUCE staggers. Things -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - go В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE slowly comes around. SELINA is gone. CAMPBELL lies smashed out on the floor in a puddle of blo DEAD. RED LIGHTS FLASH from the street. Footsteps in the hall. Voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go in yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE holds his head, spins circles and looks for a way o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just got here, only peeked through the door. Didn't want to disturb the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE tries to squeeze out the bathroom windowВ— too smal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls down yellow police tape) Who called it in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy named CHI-CHI. Claims he's the property manager. More like a PIMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON steps on his MARLBORO. Just as he touches the knob FLASS pushes past the uniformed officer. GORDON turns В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE looks out the back window В— cops everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON blocks the doorway--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hell it is. Get out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON doesn't move. FLASS muscles past GORDON and opens the door intoВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE looks out the bedroom window, it's a narrow air-sha who's bottom opens in a rubbish-filled mini-courtyard. BRUCE looks over В— THE FRONT DOOR IS OPENING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy-boy, I ain't kidding around now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON backs into the apartment, he's been shoved. BRUCE makes a desperate play and throws himself out the window. He hangs four stories up by his fingers as inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, have it your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON stands aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's what I thought--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, confronted with the sight of his DEAD PARTNER В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the window BRUCE is slipping. He tries to get his feet on the window sill below while В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said there were two bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) That's what this CHI-CHI guy said.  And that's what it looked like about three minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE can't reach the sill with his feet. GORDON squats d and inspects the body. A series of four В— DEEP SCRATCHES line CAMPBELL'S cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to GORDON) Girl who lives here goes by the name of Mistress SELINA. 21, 5'9" 120 pounds. Works an S&M dungeon, uh, obviously. She hasn't turned up yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASS casually tosses the apartment, looks out the back window, opens a wall CLOSET, picks up some handcuffsВ— BRUCE can't hold on any more.  HE SLIPS AND FALLS. While FLASS looks at the cuffs,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (TO FLASS) You don't seem all that broken up. This IS you partner here, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASS, angry, throws them back and SLAMS the CLOSET DOOR Just at the moment BRUCE CRASHES into the rat-infested rubbish below. GORDON hearing something, takes a look out the window whe BRUCE was hanging moments ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kind of shit happens everyday. I've learned to grieve in my own way, Jimmy-boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls head back in) And what, exactly, does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means I'm going to find her and put her in a box

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that simple, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the air-shaft, BRUCE climbs out from under the filth a pushes open a basement window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come ON. There's more going on here.  She didn't do this alone.  What was it? CAMPBELL wanted his graft in trade? That pimp get tired  of paying you guys off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the beat cop) YOU. Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BEAT COP leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Boy Scout, you need to think, long and hard about what you say and do on the job. You're in way over your head. Keep it up, and someone's going to get HURT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASS storms out. GORDON watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops loaf around the crime scene eating doughnuts. BRUCE tries to look inconspicuous on the sidewalk, hands in his pockets, head down. FLASS burst out of the building and s into BRUCE. FLASS shoves BRUCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch where you're going. PUNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hold eye contact for a tense moment.

dialogues.speaker: SELINA'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: GORDON is alone with the body. He stands soaking up the details with a troubled look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON sits on the bed with his arm around his wife. She's crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, come on. I didn't mean it.  It's just, raising a child in this hell hole. Maybe after my transfer goes through things will be different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN jerks her shoulder away and exits in a huff. Leaving GORDON alone with theВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Gotham City in the middle of a  crime wave? Murder, prostitution,  drugs, racketeering, all on the rise.  The commissioner's office refuses to comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the TV: THOMAS WAYNE's crest, an INTERTWINED 'T' AND '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we return: Can the Wayne Corporation  find the missing heir to THOMAS WAYNE's  fortune before the 15 year deadline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON pays no attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON sits in the waiting room outside a door marked 'Po Commissioner GILLIAN LOEB'. Loud, muffled voices argue on the other side. LOEB's SECR is doing a crossword puzzle, oblivious. The door opens, Gotham's young Assistant District Attorne HARVEY DENT, stands in it yelling back into the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't protect him forever. ESTRADA will go down and you'll go with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DENT slams the door and stomps off. The SECRETARY pushes button on the INTERCOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commissioner Loeb, there's a Detective Gordon here to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON entersВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON musters all his confidence as he approaches LOEB w works an exercise spring in his beefy fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm Detective James Gordon. I'm here about my transfer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are, Gordon. Chief Collins has told me all about you. Says you're another COWBOY, like your friend Dent there. Says you don't understand the way things are done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never met Assistant D.A. Dent, sir. And don't know why Chief Collins would say anything like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubs temples) There's no transfer for you, Gordon. It's my responsibility to train young officers a proper respect for tradition, for the established order of things. You need to learn what it takes to be a cop in Gotham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If by 'tradition' you mean graft andВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts) I suggest you be a little more selective in your manner of speech, detective. Things could get awfully difficult for you around here. And you don't want that, not for your lovely wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON'S jaw drops at the overt threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mine Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without saying a word GORDON turns and leaves В— DEFEATED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON has his GUN in his mouth. He looks down at his SHAKING FIST. He opens it В— EMPTY! This time HE'S LOADED THE BULLETS INTO THE GUN. The HAMMER pulls back В— We hear the front door open and the sounds of ANN looking through the apartment for GORDON. Then she's at the door В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim. Jim, it's a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON takes the GUN out of his mouth. It's like he has just heard her voice for the first time. bursts out of the bathroom and ENGULFS his wife in a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy. We're going to have a baby boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile crosses ANN'S lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE works like a FIEND. HE'S POSSESSED. Sweat soaks through his clothes as he HEAVES ENGINES into giant CRUSHING MACHINE. He pulls the lever.  Solid steel POPS and CRACKS like egg LITTLE AL watches, then approaches and shuts off the mach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time you slept more than two hours in a row?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought. You're going to hurt yourself. You need time to sort stuff out. Consider yourself on vacation. Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL points to BRUCE'S door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON looks tired, as if he's been up all night thinking He hasn't touched his food. But he HAS piled an ashtray f of MARLBORO butts. The counter man, DAVE, fills his coffee cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You OK, Jim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Dave, you ever notice how, sometimes, coming to a realization about something, you know, figuring out something important, only makes everything more difficult?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I guess. There was this one time my brother-in-law wanted to open a bar and the wife says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conversation is interrupted by GORDON'S RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four-Sixteen.  DUTTON HEIGHTS HOUSING PROJECTS. Hostage situation. Suspect armed and dangerous. SWAT teams have been deployed. Responding officers report to Commissioner Loeb on site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the HELL is Loeb doing there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON jumps to his feet and grabs his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up Jim, that's not even your beat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running for the door) Loeb's an animal.  It'll be a bloodbath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON runs for the door and out onto В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON drives like a madman through the run-down East End SIRENS BLARING. LIGHTNING rips across the clear sky. A storm is rolling i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNIFORMED POLICE OFFICERS hold back curious residents. A GUNMAN yells unintelligibly from the roof of the projec GORDON arrives the same time as the TV NEWS VAN from Chan One Eyewitness News. Parked at the center of the police encampment: A SWAT VAN Inside a half dozen men strap on BODY ARMOR and check the MACHINE GUNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, the COWBOY. Came to see how REAL policemen earn their pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the negotiator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT guys are climbing out of the van, ready for acti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's working a jumper on the Herzog Bridge. We don't have time to wait. Time is money, tax-payer's money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like VOTERS' money. That's it, isn't it? You're here for the TV cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON, disgusted, heads back toward his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god he's got a baby!

dialogues.speaker: GORDON STOPS. LOOKS UP.
dialogues.text: The GUNMAN in fact holds a LITTLE BABY. LOOKS OVER. LOEB's SNIPERS have taken their positions.  LIGHTNING. The GUNMAN is spinning around with the child in his arms, yelling at the lightening. The SNIPERS try to line up the shots. It's all happening too FAST. LOEB talks to the SNIPERS on a RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) The baby is in the way. It's a tough shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do your job. SHOOT HIM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUNMAN waves a 9mm over the edge of the roof. The TV CAMERAS zooms in on the GUNMAN. The situation slips OUT OF CONTROL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone save the baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Aww, fuck it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON steps out from behind the POLICE BARRICADE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon! GET YOUR ASS BACK HERE, NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON ignores him and holds up his REVOLVER with two fin on its barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! HEY YOU! I'm coming up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON drops his WEAPON В—

dialogues.speaker: THUD
dialogues.text: В— and enters the building. The TV CAMERAS eat it up. Meanwhile, across town in -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE is A BALL OF NERVOUS ENERGY; Outside, the RAIN beats down on his window. He PACES back and forth. CRASH. LIGHTNING rips across the blue sky. He tries to write a letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNDER rolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't sit still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: October 3. Dear Father, It's only getting worse. It's tearing me apart. I'm afraid it's happening.  I've let it out.  Father, I've let you down. I may have KILLED A MAN last night. I may be a MURDERER. I am no better than he was, a monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON creaks up the stairs. He approaches a DOOR that says "ROOF". He eases it OPEN. The scruffy GUNMAN yells up at TV NEWS HELICOPTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No identifying marks. A million losers never finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His blond hair, going gray, sticks to his lips as he scre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spider nasty. Don't noise it. No gangrene lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON steps out on the roof, hands open in front of him. The GUNMAN has a 9mm pressed into a LITTLE BOY'S MOUTH. HE HOLDS THE CHILD AGAINST HIS OWN CHEST.  If he fires he will kill the child AND himself. The TERRIFIED child cries for his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, my name is Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON steps forwards to shake hands. The guy freaks В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loudmouth fraud. Liberty is an ape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV NEWS CAMERAS circle overhead capturing the whole scene

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I say to him, I say, "to him".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON point to the sky, acting angry В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm, bad helicopters!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile back inВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE continues with his letterВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell me what to do, Father.  I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE picks up the WOODEN BOX. He stares at it for a long moment then suddenlyВ—

dialogues.speaker: SMACK
dialogues.text: В— it smashes the vacuum tubes of an electronics project

dialogues.speaker: POP
dialogues.text: - overloaded circuits burn out more equipment. SPARKS EXPLODE from the blown FUSE BOX В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Tell me what you want me to DO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В— and SHOWER down onto the floor. The workshop plummets into DARKNESS except for one TV.  I casts an eerie BLUE GLOW. BRUCE looks over at the TV NEWS В—

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TV
dialogues.text: - GORDON is on the roof with the GUNMAN. The GUNMAN recoils and spins looking around, frantic. GOR eases closer while he's distracted by the lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're rich. Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is your medication? You have to trust your doctors, trust in the system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON slides closer to the GUNMAN with every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything will be fine if you just follow the program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But GORDON'S words seem hollow. They have no effect on th GUNMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll change him with my love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUNMAN jams the 9mm further into the child's mouth, h about to pull the trigger. The HAMMER STARTS GOING BACK! GORDON acts without thinking. He throws a right cross В—

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCH
dialogues.text: В— dropping the GUNMAN, knocking away his 9mm just as -

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: - he pulls the trigger, missing the child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce FLINCHES at the sound of the gunshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV cameras frame a close-up shot. The GUNMAN, now lyi on the roof, reaches for the CHILD, an arm out-stretched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE's FATHER lies in a puddle of blood, an arm outstretched, reaching for YOUNG BRUCE. He grabs the BOY' hands and closes something inside them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) Your INHERITANCE. Use it wisely, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG BRUCE kneels in silence with his dying parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON is on top of the GUNMAN raining punches down on hi face В— POW, POW, POW В— until the GUNMAN stops strugglin the LITTLE BABY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE is entranced by what he sees on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON, with the LITTLE BOY on his hip, emerges from the building to the cheers of the crowd just as -

dialogues.speaker: CITY.
dialogues.text: The TV news media ignores the storm and mobs GORDON. Jam his face. BRUCE watchesВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went against direct orders from the commissioner. Why didn't you follow normal police procedures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like what passes for NORMAL in this town.  CRIME is NORMAL in GOTHAM. CORRUPTION is NORMAL. The scum of this city have taken so much from us, our youth, our families. I've declared my WAR ON CRIME! (points into the camera) Now YOU must FIGHT BACK for what's been lost!

dialogues.speaker: THE WORDS ARE A REVELATION TO BRUCE.
dialogues.text: He tears himself away from the TV and digs wildly through burning electronics until he has the scorched WOODEN BOX his shaking fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOW I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He RIPS opens the WOODEN BOX revealing his father's heavy silver SIGNET RING balled up in old newspaper. It bares the intertwined initials - 'T' and 'W'. BRUCE runs out the door with the WOODEN BOX and up onto t

dialogues.speaker: LIGHTNING.
dialogues.text: SHEETS OF RAIN fall on BRUCE's face as he slides the SIGN RING on his wet finger and screams up into the storm В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Father. Thank you. I KNOW what I must DO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING fills the sky as we В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear THUNDER. GORDON extracted himself from the throng of MEDIA who now turn on LOEB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was going through your head? Why did you try to stop Detective Gordon from saving that child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) I assure you I had no intention of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON'S heard enough. Turning away, he smiles and lights MARLBORO. A PATROLMAN jogs up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, sir. Your gun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands over GORDON'S SERVICE REVOLVER, the one he'd put his mouth so often.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like the finish has worn off the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess it's time for a new a new gun, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON takes the weapon and heads to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE, dressed in an overcoat, waits in a doorway while C CHI talks to SKINNY GIRL in fish-net stockings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if you're pregnant with the second coming of Christ. I made the appointment and you'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: October 4. Father, The trail begins with the pimp.  He is only a guppy swimming in the cesspool but he knows where she is. I must find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHI-CHI leaves the SKINNY GIRL crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She used me to KILL that man. And murder is not allowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHI-CHI passes BRUCE's doorway. FOUR DEEP SCRATCHES cross cheek. BRUCE steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the retard. Get lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Selina

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA?  She's good as dead by now. Come around tomorrow.  I'll have another dominatrix by then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want her for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? That's not what it looked like the other night. You guys got a little carried away with your games, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were THERE? You let her get away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fingers his cheek) Yeah she got away but they'll find her. She'll fry for killing that cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs CHI-CHI) You're going to help me find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly CHI-CHI stabs at BRUCE with the switchblade. BR floats to the side and stomps on the pimp's knee В—

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCH
dialogues.text: В— bending it in a way knees were never meant to bend. Th PIMP writhes in pain on the ground В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You psycho! I know you. I've seen your face, man, you can't hide

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE walks away В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so it begins. I will not let you down. Your loving son, Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a new spring in his step.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TV
dialogues.text: CHANNEL ONE EYEWITNESS NEWS runs a Special Report.  THE ANCHORMAN delivers his lines under the title 'SUPER COP'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective James Gordon wowed the city of Gotham by single-handedly rescuing a small child from the hands of an escaped mental patient and possible avoiding needless bloodshed and mayhem at the hands of this city's notoriously violent SWAT team. His comments to the press highlighted a growing rift between various departments within the police force. He hinted at charges of police corruption and promised to wage a one-man war on crime.  I don't know about you Sandy, but this reporter finds such straight talk very refreshing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed Brian. Now let's take a look at sports В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull back WIDER to see the TV plays in В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON and ANN are watching on the sofa. ANN is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a big deal. They're going to want you on talk shows, you know? You're going to need a new suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Let's go celebrate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, we can't. It's late, we've already eaten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, let's get a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim! Hello? I'm with child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. Right. Then dinner, Friday. How's La Bonne Maison sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, Fancy. It's a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN pulls her husband down on top herself, kissing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV NEWS plays in the back ground as BRUCE applies a f scar onto his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: November 8. Dear Father, the pimp knew my face. A distracting scar will hopefully mask my identity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE puts on the overcoat and wide-brimmed, concealing h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight I begin your revenge. I will rid this city of its cancer. I will draw the scum to me and make them pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE hold up his FIST and on it В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, tonight I am declaring war! Your loving son, Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE has a tourist map in his hands, he acts lost. A pair of MUGGERS saunter out of the night. They circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need some help mister. Maybe you're lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE says nothing, just soaks in the atmosphere of viole

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could use a guide to show you where the bad places are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, to protect you from the bad elements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE cracks a gentle smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take care of you mister. But you have to give us a tip. (holds out hand) NOW! MONEY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the assailants becomes impatient and SHOVES BRUCE. There is no delay in cause and effect. The shove sparks a almost ORGASMIC release of RAW, PENT UP VIOLENCE from BRU

dialogues.speaker: HE EXPLODES
dialogues.text: BRUCE PUNCHES MUGGER #1 in the CHEST, rapid-fire brutal, CRUNCH. MUGGER #2 steps into the fray. BRUCE neatly SNAPS HIS ARM

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCH
dialogues.text: В— and SWINGS an ELBOW В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SLAMS to the PAVEMENT in sudden, surprised PAIN. BRUCE stands over both the fallen MUGGERS and breathes in huge lung-full of the crisp, clear night air. A calm washes over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He delivers a final kick and walks off into the night В— CHANGED MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKINHEADS divide the contents of a BLOODY PURSE. A BEATEN WOMAN lies sobbing on the ground by some trash c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took the credit cards last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, suddenly aware of someone else in the alley, they t to see BRUCE standing over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like it's going to be a good night, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SKINHEADS descend on BRUCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE tears into the SKINHEADS with all the joy of a chil Christmas. BRUCE punches the SKINHEADS in the face, his father's SIG RING crushes flesh against bone, leaving a deep BLOODY MA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A greasy junky holds a FAKE PEARL NECKLACE up to his DEAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's all I got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'll have to go get something else. Won't you'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAY-PHONE rings. The DEALER answers BRUCE appears behind the drug DEALER at his PAY-PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you see I'm doing business here? Wait your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE grabs the DEALER'S HEAD by the hair and SLAMS IT В—

dialogues.speaker: BASH
dialogues.text: В— into the METAL PAY-PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to my war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dealer slides to the ground. BRUCE walks off. His FAKE SCAR hangs half off his cheek. sun is just beginning to peek over the worn rooftops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE sleeps. DEEP. SOUND. RESTFUL. A comforted smile teases the edges of his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN and GORDON enjoy a nice dinner together in one of Gotham's finest restaurants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To my Super Cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the most beautiful woman in Gotham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are going to be different, baby. I feel it. (notices something) SHIT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) What it is honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON watches as Commissioner LOEB and Emilio ESTRADA ar lead to a private dining room along with several scantily clad, exotic-looking women. ESTRADA hands the waiter a hundred dollar bill. His face is an emotionless mask, perfectly smooth and featureless, the result of a compulsive addiction to cosm surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who IS that with Commissioner Loeb? He looks like a zombie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON stands up and starts dumping bills on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JIM? What's the matter, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON drags wife from the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON is livid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe he's so blatant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ! Don't you read the papers? That was Emilio ESTRADA. "Gotham's Golden Pimp". The one Harvey Dent had up on charges 6 months ago. And now he's eating at La Bonne Maison with my Police Commissioner. OK? That's what's the MATTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN, hurt, jerks her hand free and walks ahead. GORDON realizes he's crossed the line. He's pissed at him for scaring his wife. He lashes out and KICKS a nearby tr can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON jogs to catch up and gently takes ANN'S arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your wife, not some rookie cop you can treat any old way you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I snapped at you. (sighs) Look. Those are BRUTAL and VICIOUS men.        And they are making this city a bad place to live, to raise OUR son. It's just, I don't know what to do.  I get angry. I get angry for US. For the BABY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touches his cheek) I know. But what can you do? You're just one man. You can't carry the whole city on you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something I CAN do. I can go over their heads. I can go to the Mayor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON puts his coat over ANN'S shoulders, they walk off. BRUCE writes a letter В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: October 12.  Dear Father, it's working. I've engaged the enemy, made progress. But I've only struck at their front line, the grunts.  Tonight, I start climbing their chain of command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then BRUCE opens a binder full of meticulous notes, drawi charts, and reports. He turns to a STREET MAP marked with red 'x's and scowls at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is easily the lowest ranking drinking establishments Gotham. Most of the bar's patrons originate from the Goth City Corrections Facility located directly across the str Flickering neon sign: "First beer free with release paper BRUCE watches from a doorway as newly released prisoners a bee-line from the jail into the COMET LOUNGE. BRUCE steps over a pair of drunks on the sidewalk and int

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place emanates PURE MENACE. The patrons consist of doomed addicts hunkered over their drinks, deflated whores and working-class thugs with over attentive eyes. MURDER seems an everyday occurrence. BRUCE takes a table away from the sodden trio on the stag accompanying a floor show of TRANSVESTITE singers and dan who double as waitresses. Once seated, BRUCE is visited by a flock of waitresses an waiters. They sit on his lap, rub up against him, play wi his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what have we here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you want a private show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, back off.  I saw him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See those little doors over there? For $50 I'll blow your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He don't want what you got, skank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have what I'm looking for either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE stuffs small bills in their sagging bras. The money attracts attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on baby, I can cheer you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress returns with a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That will be $2, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE pulls out a HUGE ROLL OF BILLS and peels off a FIFT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress registers FEAR at the sight of all that mone She barely has her money before more than a dozen THUGS s upon BRUCE from all angles with KNIVES, CLUBS, BOTTLES an POOL QUEUES. BRUCE JUMPS TO HIS FEET. The table, chair, and transvesti tumble to the ground. The FIRST GUY swings a POOL QUEUE baseball bat style. BRUCE ducks under it and В—

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCH
dialogues.text: В— comes up with a knee into the guy's groin. The SECOND GUY gets an elbow to the nose. The THIRD, FOURTH and FIFTH GUYS move in together. BRUCE drops those three with a series of vicious rabbit punches to their faces В— POP, POP, POP. But it's with numbers six through 16 that he runs into trouble. They work as a team and surround BRUCE. The first one smashes BRUCE with a chair В— Then, another clocks him in the head with a whiskey bottl And a third belts him in the jaw with brass knuckles. BRUCE staggers back. The men descend and beat him to the ground. We lose sight of BRUCE under a rain of KICKS, PUNCHES, BOTTLES and SWINGING POOL QUEUES.  Then suddenly BRUCE В—

dialogues.speaker: EXPLODES
dialogues.text: В— through the ATTACKERS, line-backer style, sending them sprawling. He breaks across the room and through a door marked 'EXIT The room goes silent В— beat В— then breaks into laughter. BRUCE has cornered himself inside the В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small, dirty room has no windows. The only other door open onto toilet stalls and a cleaning closet full of mop buckets and CLEANING SUPPLIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was almost a stupid death В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then his eyes fall on the CLEANING SUPPLIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - were it not for your birthday gifts, those chemistry sets I so loved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE rifles through the chemicals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ammonia, borax, bleach, peroxide, baking soda. Thank you, Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE grabs a PLASTIC JUG and dumps hand fulls of BORAX a BAKING SODA into it, topping it off with a blast of DRY PROPELLANT from a fire extinguisher. Outside the door in В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men taunt him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're done powdering your nose, can I have a free date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget to wash your titties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, inside В—

dialogues.speaker: INT WOMEN'S BATHROOM. THE COMET LOUNGE
dialogues.text: BRUCE picks the TOILET CAKE out of a filthy toilet and shatters it against the porcelain sink. He drops that int the PLASTIC JUG and starts mixing liquids in an empty BEE BOTTLE В— AMMONIA, BLEACH, PEROXIDE. BRUCE stabs the PLASTIC JUG with a SCREW DRIVER while out the door in В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men, now done with their taunting, approach the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE holds the PLASTIC JOG in one hand and the BEER BOTT in the other. HE takes a deep breath and dumps the liquid into the PLASTIC JOG В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the door BURSTS OPEN. A tattered and beaten BRUCE stands holding the PLASTIC JU He tosses the PLASTIC JUG at a thug but it misses and sli under the pool tables В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over. You people should get out of here, (beat) It isn't safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THUG whips out a LONG SCALLOPED KNIFE and comes at BR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see what you had for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the pool table the PLASTIC JUG BUBBLES AND STEAMS. men raise their pool queues and encircle BRUCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have it your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE jerks a neon beer advertisement off the wall as he leaps up onto a pool table. The sign shatters.

dialogues.speaker: WHOOSH
dialogues.text: The LOW-LYING GASSES go up in BLUE-HOT FLAMES. Every man standing on the floor collapses in agony В— pan fire, legs scorched. BRUCE casually steps from his pool table onto the bar В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, thank you for the dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В— walks down the bar and hops out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A badly beaten BRUCE finishes his letter with a bruised f and a black eye swollen almost shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight I learned that I am nothing more than a LUCKY AMATEUR. To climb the ladder of crime, I will need protection, weapons, technique. I need to cultivate an advantage if I'm to take my war up the ladder of crime to the bosses, to the GENERALS. But what should that advantage be, Father. How will I find it? Your loving son, Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE finishes the letter, folds it, puts it into an enve and stamps it. He looks at it for a moment then adds it t CARDBOARD SHIPPING BOX with hundreds just like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayor Noone greets GORDON at the door to his gilded, wood panelled office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you have some disturbing news regarding the East End precinct detective Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  I'm afraid so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First let me say how impressed I am that you've come forward. I know how hard these situations can be.  I want you to know I admire your bravery and integrity. We need more men like you on the force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you sir. I'm not trying to be a hero or anything. It's just that... Well, things are out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, I understand. Have a seat. Now tell me everything. Why did you come to my office? It's not the normal route. Why bypass internal affairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe the problem goes beyond the East End precinct, far higher. I've seen the money, been offered bribes В— almost forced to take them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can name names. I am willing to testify. I believe my current notoriety with the news media makes this the perfect time to bring this matter to the public. If we hold a press conference...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Whoah, slow down, Jim. I'm afraid it's not as simple as that. We have to be very careful how we present our case. Now who have you told about what you know? Who knows you've contacted me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one. I mean besides my wife.  I don't know what sort of repercussions I'd face if they knew I was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. The fewer people who know the better. You may be in serious danger if these corrupt officers knew we were working together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. OK. What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For now, I'll see what I can do on my end. I want you to lay low, act normal. I'll contact you when it's time for us to make our move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sir, there has to be something I can do to help us prepare our case. At least I can document what I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do nothing to jeopardize your safety. Keep clear of the officers involved. Let them think it's business as usual in Gotham while we work up a plan of action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stands and offers hand) Good. You'll see, we'll get these guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOONE sees GORDON to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE brings a huge pile of books to the busy young LIBRA at the checkout counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understanding Ballistics, Improvised Munitions, Explosives: Step By Step, Guerrilla Warfare, Neurochemistry, Thrown Weapons Handbook,  101 Sucker Punches... (laughs) Looks like you're starting a war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE says nothing. She looks up for the first time, sees his bruised face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? Why don't you just take these. You look trustworthy. Bring them back whenever you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIBRARIAN slowly backs away from the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE leaves with his arms full of books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: November 15.  Dear Father, I am ready for the next level. I realize now violence alone is not enough. I must become a detective, a scientist, a scholar of crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE dumps the books into the Al and Son Garage truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE shops: AMMO BELTS, HUNTING KNIFES with boot sheath, COMBAT BOOTS, BINOCULARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will need tools to give me an edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE holds up a heavy HELMET DEVICE with wires sticking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE wheels a shopping cart out of a MEGA-BOX STORE to h TRUCK. There he loads his purchases into the back: SPRAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will no longer rely on strength alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE starts the TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLERK eyes BRUCE warily as he charges through the place looking everything over. BRUCE holds up a white FIELD HOC MASK. Glares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, I can feel myself TRANSFORMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the checkout counter, THE CLERK stares numbly as acros the counter slide a GOALIE'S MASK, a PADDED GLOVES, SHIN GUARDS, and a bright-red catcher's CHEST PROTECTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Credit or cash, dude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash. Keep the change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE slaps a wad of TWENTIES on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON pulls up to a small gang of young GANG MEMBERS slinging DRUGS from the parking lot. THEY SCATTER. GORDON steers to block the escape of one GANG MEMBER, O'N

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, O'NEIL! O'NEIL! Come here. I ain't going to do nothing. I just want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm paid up man. Right on time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I know. Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'NEIL gets into the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things going OK down here these days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer CRAMDEN been taking care of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of it as quality control. We just want to make sure you're getting everything you're paying for. A happy drug dealer is a profitable drug dealer. So you're up to, what, $200 a week now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: $250 papa, and I still get the Mexicans biting into my turf. I told CRAMDEN, he said he'd take care of it but he spends all his time sampling the merchandise down at the LAB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lab, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's over there PARTYING while them Mexicans are out slinging product by MY Doughnut King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YEAH. That's SO. And I want to know what you're going to DO about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know just how to take care of this situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON grabs O'NEIL and SMASHES his face into the dashboa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me to the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON jams the dealer's head under the dash and cuffs hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON puts the car in park and watches a low-slung warehouse. Suspicious looking men stand outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corruption Log, day six. Despite the mayor's advice, I am finding it harder and harder to remain a quiet observer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON - with the cuffed O'NEIL - drives off. INT. POLICE PRECINCT HOUSE. BOOKING STATION - LATER. Jail cells line the walls of the large room. The prisoner cocky and defiant, taunt the police and laugh. They call cops PUSSIES and FAGGOTS. GORDON shoves the bruised O'NEIL into the BOOKING STATION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've transcribed testimony from one Trey O'NEIL, appendix 17, describing the officer Jonathan CRAMDEN as an enforcer for East End drug dealers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON drags O'NEIL to the BOOKING STATION amid ANGRY STA from the other officers present В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am playing a dangerous game.  These men are serious.  But I will not sit by any longer. I can't. I have a son to think about now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В— including one officer with the name "CRAMDEN" stitched his uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE reads a recipe from the Anarchist's Handbook and mi a tar-like substance on his scarred and blackened STOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: October 29. Dear Father, I will be as devious as my enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chemistry projects BUBBLE on every burner. BRUCE very carefully pours yellow liquid into a glass via

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will learn his tricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He draws a milky substance from a Pyrex beaker into a vic looking SYRINGE. BRUCE fires a COPPER WIRE out of a BLACK TUBE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will follow his lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE carries a frying pan caked in GRAY GOO out into the Junkyard. He puts it on a pile of car parts. Inserts a fuse, LIGHTS IT, and gets away fast В—

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: В— a huge EXPLOSION lights the night sky and sends debris flying in all directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will show them no mercy. Your loving son, Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE smiles at the smoking crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON'S footsteps echo through the empty garage. He puts key in the car door then, turns at a SOUND. A baseball bat drags across the concrete FLOOR. GORDON pivots as more BASEBALL BATS approach from every direction. Shadowed figures surround GORDON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the ORDERS, dudes.  Just enough to keep him out of the HOSPITAL. And out of the PAPERS. We don't want no TROUBLE for our HERO COP making it into the PAPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A baseball bat SLAMS into GORDON'S SIDE. We see SILHOUETTES as a DOZEN MEN swing BASEBALL BATS at helpless GORDON. He doesn't have a chance against the bastards. When they finish, he's lying on the ground BLEEDING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just a warning. Wouldn't want your pretty wife to get hurt because of your stubbornness, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASS drops his BLACK AND YELLOW BASEBALL BAT on GORDON. They leave, laughing and DRAGGING BATS on the concrete fl Slowly, GORDON gets to his feet and heads home to the В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON drags his battered body slowly down the hall to hi door. He enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, JIM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings shut.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CHOP-SHOP. EAST END
dialogues.text: BRUCE enters a large, dirty GARAGE where young men disman expensive SPORTS CARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: November 2. Dear Father, you always told me, if a job is difficult, then I'm using the wrong tools. Today I test that theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes fall on the tall stranger as he flings open his OVERCOAT. He's wearing the brightly colored SPORTS GEAR under his c and the CATCHER'S MASK under his wide-brimmed hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put these on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses a pile of HANDCUFFS on a work bench. The thieves, STUNNED for a moment, break out laughing. They attack with the tools of their trade В— BUTANE TORCH CUTTERS, HAMMERS. BRUCE takes a terrible beating but he gives back at least twice what he's getting. Until an UNDER-BOSS pulls out a GUN. BRUCE SLAMS a handful of GLASS VIALS into the gunman's ch WHITE PHOSPHOROUS EXPLOSIONS blinds the would be shooter, burns his clothes and face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, that's enough fun for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE throws another handful of VIALS at the criminals В—

dialogues.speaker: POP, POP, POP
dialogues.text: В— the men instantly fall to their hands and knees vomiti BRUCE makes his exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE'S catcher's mask FLIES through the air and SHATTERS against stone WALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much protection, just slowed me down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chest protector slips into a dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
