dialogues.text: BRUCE, naked, SEWS STITCHES INTO HIS STOMACH with a NEEDL AND THREAD. DEEP CUTS on his back ooze blood, they're stitched up onl far around as he can reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the tools but not the methodology. Something is still missing. Father.  I need an edge, an advantage В—

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TV -
dialogues.text: Under the words SPECIAL REPORT В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criminals are a superstitious and cowardly lot.  It's obvious this vigilante is trying to scare and intimidate them with violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Right BRIAN, the vigilante marks his victims with a wound shaped lake a BAT.  An obvious reference to the occult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They show victims with MARKS ON THEIR FACES. BRUCE looks at his father's SIGNET RING and picks somethi (a piece of flesh?) out of it with the SEWING NEEDLE. The TV shows a scared MUGGER in Gotham Prison's Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I make a few MISTAKES and I get THIS? I get MARKED! People won't even TALK to me! I been MARKED by the BAT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know, JANE, not everyone thinks the vigilante is the bad guy here. A lot of Gotham's common citizens are happy to see those people get what they deserve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for that report, BRIAN. Up next, THE BAT-MAN Vigilante: Friend or Foe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Father. Now I see. Thank you. Your loving son, Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE looks over at the pile of supplies left over from h shopping spree. BRUCE SMILES WIDE. He's missing all his front teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayor NOONE storms into LOEB's office. He's pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loeb, what the hell is going on here? Police officers beaten in the precinct parking garage? This is an officer who has come to me with serious accusations against this department. How do you think that looks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayor, sit down. (Mayor sits) You should leave this to me. Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Gillian, our operations. He knows too much, and he isn't backing off. Maybe we should slow things down.  If he goes to the press...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts) And maybe you need to remember who's running this show.  I'll say when we slow things down, which will be NEVER, AND how we handle Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was at my office again. Said he's making a file documenting what he knows. I tried to get it but he wouldn't hand it over. He's a loose cannon. There's no telling what he might do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you worry, Frank. I'm putting Gordon where he can't do any harm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOEB smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE cuts a HOCKEY MASK in half and spray-paints it blac along with the AMMO BELT, the GROIN PROTECTOR and KNIFE. He paints a pair of STEEL DENTURES white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: November 6. Dear Father, it's all coming together. I can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE welds a familiar but primitive BAT LOGO into a pair brass knuckles. He tries them on over a pair of HEAVY LEA GLOVES with razor blades fitted into the side-seams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have everything I need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE fills the ammo belt with: ROPE, DUCT TAPE, LOCK PIC SET, dangerous looking STUN GRENADES В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the pieces are falling into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В— SYRINGES labeled 'stimulant', 'pain killer', 'truth se 'fear toxin' В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is changed.  I am reborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В— SMOKE BOMBS, also home made and dangerous looking -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will show them no mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RECORDER, BINOCULARS, SEWING KIT, and SUPER-GLUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, you will have your revenge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce puts on the LEATHER GLOVES and - click - the AMMO B around his waist.

dialogues.speaker: COMMISSIONER LOEB'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: GORDON stands at attention before LOEB's huge, walnut des He's swollen and bruised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Gordon.  I heard about the unfortunate incident the other day. (sarcastic) Funny, you'd think a trained police officer would have no problem with thugs in the precinct garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOEB is taken back. Was that some kind of jab? He continu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm reassigning you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON suppresses a smile, hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The press has its panties in a bunch, asking questions, hounding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOEB enjoys it, draws it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And because you seem to need a, umm, SAFER environment. I'm putting you on THE BAT-MAN vigilante case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON scowls. Pure rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON pounds on an old TYPEWRITER at the kitchen table. MARLBOROS overflow an ash tray. ANN stands behind him in nightgown, hands on his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, can't this wait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This file is my only chance. They put me on THE BAT-MAN case to get rid of me. I can't let Loeb push me aside that easily. I've got to compile the evidence Noone needs to take them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, honey. But come to bed soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a kiss and leaves. GORDON resumes typing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Section fourteen: Commissioner Loeb. Based on interviews and my direct contact with the commissioner, I believe it is possible the commissioner's involvement goes far deeper than the kickback slush fund. Loeb may be CONTROLLING all organized crime in Gotham City. As of now these allegations are mere speculation, I don't have the resources to pursue that line of inquiry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON sighs, lights another MARLBORO and goes back to wo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON walks down dark stairs, along a long corridor, dow more stairs, past dripping pipes, through a door, down another hallway with flickering lights, to the door to В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the walls hang maps with numbered pins, police sketche THE BAT-MAN and photos of the MARKS on victims' faces. As GORDON enters, a young police officer, MERKEL, jumps u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, sir. Three more came in last night sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess, we'll find all of them in the prison wing at Gotham Mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. All three, admitted last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better hit the road then. I can get my coffee on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON leaves. MERKEL runs after him pulling on his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON and MERKEL meet Dr. Wallace as they pass through security. They talk as they walk through the busy ward. Everywhere beaten men lie cuffed to hospital beds. Some i traction, or horrible looking braces. Almost all bear the MARK OF THE BAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning doctor. I hear you have a few more guests for us to talk to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merkel. Gordon. Your lacerations seem to be healing nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring the remark) So what do you have for us today'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple guys from an electronics store heist. Broken clavicle, some ribs, dislocated shoulder, concussion and about 12 hours surgery between 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the other one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pusher from Stilmore Heights. He'll need some dental work and he took about 75 stitches but he's OK. We have him in isolation if you want to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems he was made to eat his own product. We've had to keep him away from the general population.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor stops to inspect the chart for a man in bandag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to MERKEL) Do you notice anything about these men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the mark of the bat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm talking about their spirit. These men are broken. Scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MERKEL looks around. HE'S RIGHT! Some of the criminals ar even crying. Just then the doctor opens a door for the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your drug dealer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corner of the padded room cowers the former shell once-tough street pusher. His haunted eyes are framed by stitched-up wounds that still very much resemble a bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey DENT opens a door bearing the words, "HARVEY DENT, ASSISTANT DISTRICT ATTORNEY" for GORDON. The two men enter together. GORDON carries a note pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding me! I'm THE BAT-MAN vigilante? My wife will love this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're young, you work out. And I've seen your record. You have no love of organized crime. I saw the ESTRADA trial on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well he's still on the streets, isn't he. If I was the vigilante, ESTRADA would be making license plates right now, not running Gotham's prostitution racket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it must be FRUSTRATING. (flipping through notes) You know, ESTRADA's operation has been hit quite a few times. A detective was even killed at one of his brothels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard. Detective CAMPBELL. No big loss for the department from what I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON smiles at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I have a list of dates and times. I'd like you to account for your whereabouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes the list) Sorry detective, I was in DC at a convention for three of these dates and my wife will tell you I was home with her for most of the rest. I'm not your BAT-MAN. Wish I was but I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't. He's a dangerous psychopath. And when I catch him, he's going down hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised to hear you say that Gordon. I hear you're one of few remaining good cops on the force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Christ, not you too. You of all people should know, we live in a society of laws. This guy isn't a hero. He thinks he's above the law. He's a terrorist. Plain and simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON lights another MARLBORO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA and HOLLY now live in a large warehouse divided by plywood into dozens of small rooms for prostitutes. Their cubicle sports a sagging bed and a gaudy pink paint-job. ceiling is chicken wire. Hundreds of voices В— arguing, copulating, flirting В— fi cavernous space around and above their cubicle. Selina wears a blonde wig. It's dinner time, SELINA: Tuna from a can, HOLLY: Pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA, I don't like it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush. Keep your voice down. I'm Mistress Kitty now. You have to remember that. No one can know who we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't like it any better than you, OK? But I've got an idea. We can change things В— for real this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to take a little something  back from those bastards. I'm going to make them pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we just leave town, go somewhere where CHI-CHI and the cops can't find us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on HOLLY. If it isn't CHI-CHI, it's going to be someone else. (moves closer to HOLLY) Now, I've been talking to some of the girls who work down on Franklin street. They say sometimes city limos pick up girls down there for parties. I figure we get a camera...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) You're SCARING me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, maybe it's TIME we did some scaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA finishes her tuna and throws the can to a black ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON smokes a cigarette and watches a small monitor set on his desk. MERKEL stands behind him with his coat on. The security tape, CHOPPY and GRAINY, shows the inside of jewelry store. Four men climb through a broken window and begin stuffing their pockets with gems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch this. He scares the crap out of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly they all jump in surprise. A dark SHADOWY FIGURE enters the frame. It's THE BAT-MAN we can't make out exactly what he looks like. To us he's a big, black hulk. The men back away, SCARED. THE SHADOWY FIGURE LEAPS ON TH There's a fight but it's over very quickly. The SHADOWY FIGURE leaves the thieves TWITCHING on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. The guy is BRUTAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. BRUTAL and VICIOUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you call it a night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've still got a little more work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Well, good night, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MERKEL leaves. GORDON hits rewind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON sits in his parked car between Al and Son's Garage the CATHOUSE. CHI-CHI yells at the girls as he hobbles down the steps a gets in his car. A moment later he pulls out. GORDON stubs out his cigarette and pulls out after him. From a nearby ROOFTOP a large shadowy silhouette watches both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON bursts in unannounced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey, I need a favor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning to you too, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a search warrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need a warrant to search my place, Jim. You're always welcome. Come over tonight and dig through my underwear drawer for a mask and cape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, you're not a suspect anymore, Harvey. You're just not BAT-MAN material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife will be so disappointed. She's really into the suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, OK. I didn't need to hear that. (gets serious) It's not a BAT-MAN thing, Harvey.  I've got a hunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hunch? Aren't you supposed to stick to THE BAT-MAN case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I need you for. I can't request it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, I'm listening

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After we spoke, I got to thinking about the CAMPBELL murder. He was killed INSIDE one of ESTRADA's cathouses, just before the vigilante appeared. And ESTRADA's prostitution ring has been hammered by the vigilante.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you think ESTRADA can lead you to THE BAT-MAN?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or the other way around. It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I just want to take a look inside one of ESTRADA's warehouses.  OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. OK. You got it. I'll put the request in front of Judge Gillen this afternoon. Jim, this BAT-MAN thing is really getting to you, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's slippery and he's getting better. Doing bigger and bigger criminals. He's changing his M.O., using a random pattern so we can't catch him. And he's been working on his disguise. It's... TRANSFORMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow runs across the gravel toped surface, and leaps the next roof. Seen from below as a fast, fluttering blur against a clou filled night-sky. He's going from high buildings to lower ones, jumping and rolling into the shadows. A window opens, a confused person looks out .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that Harold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty, ferchristsake, close the window. You'll catch your death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty closes the window and gets back to her life. We follow his progress but have trouble seeing him. We ca a glimpse as he LEAPS from a high building across an alle onto the fire escape on the other side. Then he's gone over the lip of the roof. This is THE BAT-MAN's environment, elevator rooms drippin with tar, the water towers, the TV antennas, ABANDONED mattresses, old chairs, cable TV hookup boxes, the crisp night air, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new identity changes everything, Father. I have an edge. I stay off the streets, work only at night. I stab fear in their hearts. I HAVE BECOME  THEIR NIGHTMARE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we finally get a good look at THE BAT-MAN decked out his new threads. He's MASSIVE, TERRIFYING, SPECTACULAR. He stands on the edge of a high roof, silhouetted against giant full moon, watching an В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below GORDON and a bunch of UNIFORMED COPS file out of a warehouse. GORDON balls up a search warrant and throws it into the gutter, DISGUSTED. The cops drive off moments before CHI-CHI arrives in his and hobbles on crutches inside the В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHI-CHI makes his way through rows of stacked cardboard b and rolls of carpet. Then it's, slowly and painfully, up a flight of wooden st to an office, the kind with glass windows overlooking the warehouse and high glass skylights. In the office, five young men drape themselves over leath sofas, smoking, and throwing potato chips at a group of young, malnourished women who cower on the floor. SANCHEZ, an older, fat man, sits behind a desk on the pho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) They just left. Yeah, they had a warrant. Bunch of pussies. I told them they're house cleaners. Hey, what can they do? The girls have papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody greets CHI-CHI as he enters. No one offers him a s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they look good too. No, I got the Russian ones. Oh yeah? No shit! The shipment from Honk Kong or the Mainland? Well I hope they're as good as these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, CHI-CHI. Leg still hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well sometimes when it's wet out I get this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) No one cares. What's our take for the week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHI-CHI crutches over and puts a yellow paper bag from a department store on SANCHEZ 's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks in the bag) OK? What the hell is OK? We don't pay you for OK. We want good. We want great. We want freaking excellent out of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's been problems lately.  Business is off. This vigilante is keeping the Johns away. He's got everyone scared to...

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: A shower of glass drops from an overhead skylight. THE BAT-MAN lands on SANCHEZ' desk. A terrifying demon of the night. Pure menace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I'm here to ask you a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are stunnedВ— paralyzed by fear until SANCHEZ pul UZI from a holster and fires a volley at THE BAT-MAN. BUT HE'S GONE. The bullets strike CHI-CHI in the CHEST. HE GOES DOWN. THE BAT-MAN is in the air, he somersaults over the men on sofas. Smoke Bombs fly from his fingers. POP. POP. POP. POP. Then it's all shadows and confusion. Guns fire.  BAM.  BAM. BAM. Bones CRACK. People SCREAM. Guns - CLICK. CLICK. CLICK. - empty. Finally a body smashes through the plate glass onto the warehouse floor. A chimney effect takes place. The smoke, longer trapped, is quickly sucked out the broken skylight leaving THE BAT-MAN and SANCHEZ the lone people on two fe SANCHEZ, in shock, clicks his empty gun. The women break for the door and scatter into the night. A man clutches his throat and writhes on the desk. Without ever removing his eyes from SANCHEZ, THE BAT-MAN draws a knife and jabs it into the choking man's throat. Instant tracheotomy. The man can breathe, he slides, relieved, to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now then, where is your boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN grabs SANCHEZ by the head with both hands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is ESTRADA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down... docks... new girls... shipment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN throws SANCHEZ to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black LINCOLN CONTINENTAL drives through the bleak, bar streets of Gotham at BREAK-NECK SPEED. It is no ordinary LINCOLN CONTINENTAL В— It's the BAT-MOB Its windows are tinted opaque. Heavy, steel bumper modifications have been welded to the chassis. The hood h been chopped back to make room for the super-charged scho bus engine that powers it. And it drives without headlights. LIKE A CAR POSSESSED, reckless and demonic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armed guards playing cards at a table. At the service entrance, a guy draws back the peep hole i reenforced steel door just as В—

dialogues.speaker: CLANG
dialogues.text: The door FLIES OFF IT'S HINGES and skids, sparking across parking lot on a chain behind the BAT-MOBILE. The guards rush outside, guns at the ready. The LINCOLN CONTINENTAL does a skidding 180 dragging the heavy door. BAT-MAN accelerates, then stomps the brakes. The heavy ST DOOR flies past him SMASHING into the guards. Meanwhile, attracted by the noise. More armed men rush do the staircase. Enter THE BAT-MAN В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two options: Tonight you men can go to prison or to the prison hospital, the choice is yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first goon to recover LEVELS A SHOTGUN. THE BAT-MAN throws a VICIOUS KICK to the guy's CROTCH bef he can fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the one I HOPED you'd pick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN leaps into the fray Taloned claws sink into a man's shoulder, he screams as h THROWN THROUGH A WINDOW. Another thug swings a bat. THE BAT-MAN kicks him in the chest, grabs his bat from mi air and flings it В—

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCH
dialogues.text: В— into the face of another gunner across the room. A guy gets the drop on THE BAT-MAN with a machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are seven working defenses from this position. Three of them disarm with minimal contact. Three of them kill. The other just HURTS!

dialogues.speaker: CRACK
dialogues.text: He throws a MAIMING SIDE-KICK into a guy's hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's young, Father. He'll probably walk again. But he'll stay SCARED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN puts a foot between another's shoulder blade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear clouds their judgement, makes them stiff and clumsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys keep pouring down the stairs. THE BAT-MAN throws one OVER THE RAIL.  Another goes THROU WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are like rag dolls to me now. To be thrown aside and forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A third gets CRUSHED UNDERFOOT as THE BAT-MAN continues t climb, floor by floor, to the top. It's been a tough fight. He's sweated through his clothes lost his cape but the action only makes him stronger. A G OF EXCITEMENT shines off him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is only one man I am looking for tonight. He's the GENERAL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, now, before him ESTRADA tries to muster some composu He's run out of men to fight for him and stands surrounde half-starved Asian women with hate in their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, ESTRADA. At last we meet face to face. Such as it is. You're coming with me. I have a lot of questions for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ESTRADA is backing to the wall in pure fear. THE BAT-MAN' gloved hand covers his eyes. Everything goes DARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close up of a syringe. The tip makes a dimple in ESTRADA's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Hydro-strychnine-sulfate, you can think of it as a cross between truth serum and the worst acid trip of your life. Makes the stuff they had a Woodstock feel like aspirin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN presses the sinister syringe into ESTRADA's carotid artery. There's an immediate change in ESTRADA's attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An obviously drugged ESTRADA, duct taped to a 6th floor f pole, rants loudly. A few cops stand around looking up at the spectacle. A crowd has gathered. ESTRADA yells to anyone who will listenВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get the girls from overseas. They work for us. Loeb takes money, he runs the show. The trains run on time. Keeps the show on the road. Police say, you do your job, we do your job. No wait. I do my job you pay me. Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go to parties sometimes. I have a nice car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a junior cop) Cut him down before someone hears him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop cuts him down and we cut forward to В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON rages at a desk sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man is a known felon. He's on the MOST WANTED LIST. We have numerous witnesses who heard him confessing to serious racketeering and corruption operations. You can't just let him go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks. I got my orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kicking the desk, hard) Dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DENT pulls GORDON off.        .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Jim, calm down. What do you expect, the man was assaulted, drugged, kidnapped. Nothing he says is admissible in court. No sane person will prosecute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bull. It was Loeb who sprung him to cover his own butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON stomps off in a rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN sits in his LINCOLN CONTINENTAL across the st from the police station. In the morning light it looks mo like a souped-up limo than a demon car - ALMOST. THE BAT-MAN is totally messed up. His clothes hang in tatters. Blood puddles in the foot-well of the car. He listens to the tapes of ESTRADA's 'confession' В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on tape) Loeb runs the whole thing, uses cops as bagmen to collect and distribute the        money. He's into everything, numbers, drugs, girls, guns. You name it, he gets a cut. Hey, you don't look like my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click. THE BAT-MAN turns off the machine and looks out his tinte window. GORDON storms out of the precinct house. A dazed and rumpled looking ESTRADA (newly released) and FLASS (his releaser) share a smile at GORDON'S obvious fu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The enemy is everywhere, even HERE. These so called policemen nurture the cancer, they breed it in men like ESTRADA and turn it lose on my streets. It looks like ESTRADA is only another soldier. The real generals live in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN looks up at the GOTHAM JUSTICE BUILDING and s out loud В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your turn Loeb. I'm coming after YOU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a painful effort, THE BAT-MAN puts the car in gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I must climb higher still.  Your loving son, Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LINCOLN drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL walks down the same crappy sidewalk as before w his coffees and doughnuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL enters a transformed junk yard.  Piles of junk been moved. Rearranged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All around LITTLE AL sees evidence of TARGET PRACTICE, STRANGE DEVICES and SMALL EXPLOSIONS.  There's the LINCOL CONTINENTAL with BLOOD POOLED ON THE SEAT. He follows BLOOD DROPLETS up the wooden stairs that lead BRUCE's apartment. The door hangs slightly ajar. LITTLE A pushes it open and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE's apartment has been TRANSFORMED into a crime fight command center. There's a HUGE FLOW chart describing Gotham's crime organizations, people's names, rank, jobs and police involvement. Pictures of LOEB and ESTRADA hang from the wall with duct tape. Crime fighting gear lays piled on the tables (and i that CHI-CHI's paper department store bag of money?). In a series of metal lockers we can see the progression o BRUCE's suits, belts, weapons and disguises. Some broken. Many caked with blood. LITTLE AL finds THE BAT-MAN lying UNCONSCIOUS ON THE FLOO He's lost a lot of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE comes around in his bed. His eyes flutter and then open. He's momentarily confused. LITTLE AL sits nearby drinking a coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... didn't call the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE looks at his bandages. Not a bad job at all. He tri to sit up. Too painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Settle down boy, let me tell you something. I seen a lot of people get cut all to pieces in the jungle. And after, I seen even more come home all cut up on the inside. Now, they trained me to heal a man on the outside with bandages and thread. But there ain't nothing anyone can do for those wounds on the inside. You just stay the hell out of the way and hope they sort it out for themselves. I've been wondering when you were going to go off. But this? This is something else. (beat) You know it's a lucky thing we're the same blood type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL holds up his arm. He's got a transfusion hose g from it into BRUCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we weren't, I'd have HAD to take you to the hospital. And they would have thrown your ass in Arkham Asylum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON follows an orderly through the large, time-worn Victorian building. Strange sounds emanate from doors lining the hallways В— WHIMPERING. GIGGLING. SOBBING. A pair of ORDERLIES pass wheeling a young, very pale man straight jacket. He has green-ish hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) You're joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON watches them go by before knocking on an office do marked, "Dr. Patricia Holcomb, MD, Ph.D. Director.' INT. PATRICIA HOLCOMB'S OFFICE - AFTERNOON. Patricia Holcomb is a handsome woman reaching early middl age with all the dignity that could be expected of someon who spends their lives surrounded by the criminally insan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for seeing me doctor.  I'll try not to take up much of your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all detective. I've been following your vigilante case with some interest. An intriguing mind.  I look forward to hosting it, if that's possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say that as if you don't think we're going to catch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure you can, not alive anyway. I've read the files you sent over. They describe a man who inhabits a delusional world of great danger and violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danger and violence. Sounds about right for the East End.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, but this mind inhabits a world more horrible than the East End. A world so threatening and dangerous that it's had to create a new persona, a new IDENTITY to cope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy's become a demon in order to fight his demons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Now, normally this kind of delusion represents the terminal stage of a suicidal psychosis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to kill himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes and no. Something is keeping it going. A quest or a mission of some sort. Much like the crusaders in ancient Europe who were capable of great feats by virtue of their belief or faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean flying? X-ray vision?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing like that I assure you.  More like mothers lifting cars off children during emergencies. Or even monks and Yogis who's faith allows them to do incredible things with their bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how do I catch him before his faith does any more "great feats" to the citizens of this city?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that's your problem Detective. My job is knowing what makes them thick, not what makes them run. I will tell you this though, that mind is starting to enjoy its work. It's capable of anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on doctor, what do I DQ? How do I stop him before he kills someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose you strike at the weaknesses. What is this great delusion protecting? It didn't just come into being over night. It started long ago with a young boy being terribly, terribly hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Interesting. Thank you doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON stands to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON, lost in thought, digs for his keys. He's startled JANET SELLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Gordon, Detective Gordon.  Wait up a second. JANET SELLING, Channel One News. Can I have a word with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I'm in a rush here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll only take a second.  I want to ask about allegations of corruption in the precinct. I'm hoping you'll corroborate some of the rumors I've been hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really AM in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hurry to what, chase a mental case? Doesn't it ANGER you that you've been put out to pasture while all through the department corruption is running rampant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON SPINS on her, furious. Then catches himself and smiles. SHE GOT HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, what do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELLING smiles and takes out a note pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN climbs up a black iron DRAIN SPOUT in the rai It's DIRTY, SLIPPERY, DANGEROUS work. Gotham City spreads out, glittering and twinkling, far be

dialogues.speaker: INT GOTHAM JUSTICE BUILDING. LOEB'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: LOEB sits in a red leather club chair drinking brandy as Mayor NOONE paces the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see Channel One News? They just ran a big police corruption story.  Someone's talking. It's that damn Gordon, I'm telling you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to have to take drastic measures with that detective. But right now we've got bigger problems. Our friends on the street are making some seriously unhappy noises about this vigilante.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake, Gillian! Things are slipping into chaos. What's going on around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, exactly. For now, our boys on the force are keeping our associates calm. But I'd like to meet face-to-face, let them air their concerns, do a little damage control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Sounds like you're talking about one of your parties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I talked to ESTRADA he'll bring some girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All his girls are so В— PRISSY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I know you like 'em more, umm, assertive. We'll find you a party favor. I'll see to it myself. And by the way, here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOEB tosses a yellow envelope like the one FLASS tried to give to GORDON, only fatter, at the mayor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The precinct guys wanted you to have this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mayor flips through it, smiles. We pan out the window to В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large gargoyle sits hunched on the granite facade of th justice building. Wrapped in his cape, THE BAT-MAN remains unmoving in the cold, pouring rain. Pigeons walk around on the ledge next him, cooing and pecking at bird excrements and smog fallo A wire runs along the ledge leading to a small contact microphone attached to the window. THE BAT-MAN grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self) Oh boy, we've been invited to a party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reels in his contact mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON bursts in, interrupting.  It's becoming a pattern these two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up Jim. You look terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (paces the room) My office was ransacked. They were at my apartment too. Broke the locks, tossed the place. They tried to make it look like burglars but I think it was Flass and his crew looking for my file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not surprised, after that news story, you're likely to be public enemy number one to those guys. In fact, that file MAY be only thing keeping you alive at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, because they FOUND it and they TOOK it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here sit down, have some coffee. You got to get out of town, disappear for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, I'll go up to a cabin in the woods and die of multiple, accidental hunting gunshot wounds to the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, calm down Jim. Just take it easy. There has to be something you can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. It's business as usual for me. I play the good soldier, stay low and hunt for my BAT-MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't want you to catch the vigilante, they would give you some manpower if they did. And when you capture the guy, they're going to crucify you on the news. This guy's becoming a saint to some people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a terrorist, Harvey. A DANGEROUS PSYCHOPATH. Who knows how far he'll take his personal war on crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's really scary to think how far a guy will go to rid this town of crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DENT meant that as a JAB but GORDON missed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A limo rolls through the darkened streets.  As it passes nasty, SKANKY whores fly into a frenzy. They desperately prostrate themselves before the car. ALL BUT ONE. She's different. Confident and attractive wh the others twitch and vamp, PITIFUL and HORRID. IT'S SELINA. She's dressed in knee-high black boots, blac leather pants, a leather halter top.  She wears her wig a carries a whip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOEB assesses SELINA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the driver) That one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the next thing you know SELINA is inside В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOEB lives in a beautiful, old-world mansion, one of the benefits he's received from his long career of graft. SELINA lies on his FOUR POSTER BED in his tacky mirror-an silk bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make yourself at home darling. I have some business to attend to, then I'll introduce you to a good friend of mine. He's eager to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment LOEB leaves, descending the grand staircase, SELINA dumps her purse on the bed В— cuffs, whips, rubber and a SMALL CAMERA with a long TRIGGER CORD. She finds a hiding place for the CAMERA and strings the C under the headboard. Then she casually begins to case the place В— turns over CERAMICS to read the brand, checks out the SILVER HAIR BR She grabs a SATIN PILLOW CASE and fills it with loot. She peeks through a gilded door it leads to a staircase. Intrigued, SELINA descends to another door that leads to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA cautiously enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off-duty cops and gangsters party with ESTRADA's exotic looking whores. Drugs in high piles cover silver platters ESTRADA talks to FLASS by a lion statue. Beautiful women trays with expensive liquor. LOEB makes his entrance, followed by Mayor NOONE. LOEB's guests stand as he takes a glass and clinks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen I've brought a guest with me this evening. Mayor NOONE would like to express his gratitude for the civil way you've all conducted your business these last few years.  Isn't that right mayor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, indeed. I am very grateful for the restraint you've shown by keeping your businesses localized to your own, umm, areas of expertise and I would like to pledge to you all В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) All right, fine.  Down to business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOEB takes a seat in a big leather club chair by the fire NOONE looks around for a chair, finds none and wanders ov towards the BAR. But unbeknownst to the party, one more person is in attendance. He's В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN has his contact microphone attached to the wi of the living room. He listens intently to the conversati taking place inside -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOEB holds forth, the center of attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our topic of discussion this evening: THE BAT-MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MURMUR goes through the gangsters. While nearby in В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA roots around. She checks out STATUES, lifts CARPET tosses the odd GOLD CIGAR CLIPPER into her PILLOW CASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOEB continues В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen I know THE BAT-MAN has caused some problems for our operations. But his activities must be kept in proper perspective. He is an annoyance, nothing more. A temporary fly in a very rich ointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you CRAZY? Do you know how many of my boys that PSYCHO has hospitalized?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is absolutely preposterous that you would even think about leaving this nut case to ruin our businesses like this. After what he's done to our OPERATIONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, SELINA continues to rifle through В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's made her way into the DESK DRAWER. She finds CASH, a SILVER PLATED GUN, a SAFE DEPOSIT BOX K Some PAPERS grab her attention В— GORDON'S. She reads a little bit, finally she just dumps the whole drawer, PAPERS and all, into the PILLOW CASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The arguing continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of the big picture. Sooner or later, we'll get lucky and someone will put a bullet in this nut. Until then, the media love him. He gives the impression that the city is getting safer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men, starting to catch his drift, nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN has heard all he cares to hear. He's about to crash the party with the HAND GRENADE he ho in his fist В— two inches from his mouth dangles its circ pin. Suddenly his head snaps to the side. He's heard something that we haven't. He's not at all pleased. Close up shot of the pin being replaced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conversation continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This 'war on crime' forms the perfect cover for our operations. We don't want to jeopardize them now that the money is really starting to pour in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouts and stomping feet interrupt LOEB's appeal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three armed security guards burst into the room and catch SELINA, red handed trying to pry open a locked cabinet. S tripped an alarm. SELINA turns and without missing a beat assumes a regal a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How DARE you enter without knocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men look confused as she approaches. Once she is close enough to the guards, she whips off her leather belt and В—

dialogues.speaker: CRACKS
dialogues.text: В— the first one across the face with the buckle, knockin gun free. Then В—

dialogues.speaker: RIPS
dialogues.text: В— her long nails across the second's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three more guards rush toward the door, GUNS DRAWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burst in to find SELINA securing the two guards toge in a very complicated and painful looking way with her be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, my miserable little pets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But these guards aren't falling for it В—

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: В— they open fire. SELINA dives behind the desk. Bullets rips into the antiq mahogany. The dust settles. The guards LAUGH and move in for the ki When suddenly В—

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: A BLACK LINCOLN CONTINENTAL SMASHES into the study, takin out a wall of WINDOWS. CHAOS.  CONFUSION.  GUNFIRE.  SHOUTS. The back end of the LINCOLN FISHTAILS, demolishing the antique DESK and two GUARDS. The front end of the LINCOLN SCREECHES to a stop, a WHEEL inch from SELINA's face. The DOOR of the LINCOLN SWINGS OPEN. SELINA looks up, stunned to see THE BAT-MAN standing up through the moon roof of the car. He holds a BLACK TUBE. A security guard levels his UZI at the pair but before he get off a shot В—

dialogues.speaker: THANG
dialogues.text: В— he's hit in the chest with two BRASS PARTS attached to COPPER WIRES. The wires lead to a massive, dripping BATTERY in the car. The guard FLINCHES and FOAMS AT THE MOUTH from the effect the PRIMITIVE TAZER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to SELINA) Get in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does. TIRES SQUEAL. THE BAT-MAN tosses a GRENADE past her into the STUDY GREN CLACKS across the FLOOR, emitting a sharp, accelerating SIGNAL. This ain't no smoke bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heavy LINCOLN CONTINENTAL sends rooster tails of expensive, manicured lawn high in the air. From all directions security guards open fire with shotgu pistols and uzis. They rake the car with bullets. INT. THE BAT-MAN'S LINCOLN CONTINENTAL - NIGHT. SELINA freaks out as bullets CLINK and CLANK around her, bouncing off sinister looking canisters strapped in the a where the back seat should be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep low and cover your ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA gives THE BAT-MAN an incredulous look then does exactly what he says as outside on the В—

dialogues.speaker: KA-BLAM
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN's grenade goes off sending a fireball out of several window and shattering many more. FROM THE FIRE leaps ESTRADA and FLASS, GUN BLAZING. Behind him stumbles COMMISSIONER LOEB, desperately trying pat down his burning HAIR, and Mayor NOONE, just plain stunned. ONE BULLET cuts a bloody STREAK across BATMAN'S shoulder. pays it no heed. SELINA stares at him. A little turned on. The LINCOLN bounces through a wrought iron fence and onto tree-lined road. Seconds behind it, a pair of white limos give chase. Out on the dark road the LINCOLN CONTINENTAL is almost invisible, driving at ridiculous speeds without headlight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN, drives with crude home-made night-vision gog while SELINA appraises the man next to her. Slowly she makes a hand gesture as if she were picking up phone. With her thumb and pinky she puts the imaginary headset to her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello mom. I've met a guy. I think I'm in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking you to prison for the murder of a police officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN cuffs her to the dashboard. She's shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guards call for assistance on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a road block on Bridge road at the junction of Highway 6. Do you copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the radioВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Gotham Sheriff's Department. I copy, we're on our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN listens to the transmission on his own radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA braces herself as he wrenches the steering wheel. darkened LINCOLN SWERVES to a stop in the woods. Out on the road, both pursuing limos rip past doing lO0 m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a windy,  tree lined road through the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he there yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From the radio) We're in position but he hasn't shown up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He should be on you any second. We're right behind him. Be ready.  OH SHIT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the limo rounds the a corner it's greeted by two cop c forming a ROADBLOCK. The driver desperately CUTS THE WHEEL but it's too late. big car SKIDS sideways and SMASHES into the cops. The second limo SLAMS into the first. Cops DIVE for cover. GLASS AND HUBCAPS go everywhere. Slowly the doors open and dazed security guards get out o the crumpled cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell did he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stops and turns to look up the road at THE BAT-M Lincoln Continental as it slowly approaches the crash sit Suddenly В— BAM! В— super high-powered KLEIG LIGHTS shine forth from the Lincoln. The men cover their eyes, temporarily BLINDED, as the omi black car accelerates into the wrecked cars. Its heavy bumpers sink into the doors of the cop cars and grind them backwards and out of the way. Some of the cops and security guards regain their wits an open fire with their pump action shotguns and uzis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant gloved fist pounds a series of heavy-duty switche bolted onto the dashboard. Both sides and the rear of the car erupt В— BLAM! BLAM! B В— road spikes - FOOH! FOOH! В— smoke - SPLASH! В— oil - CRACK! CRACK! В— and tire-puncturing darts. The gunmen stagger back, punctured, pierces and slimed by cannonade. The Lincoln lays a generous TIRE PATCH as it accelerates, down the wooded road. Behind it the stabbed and oil-covered men can do nothing watch, stunned as the Lincoln disappears into the darknes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click.  Click.  And SELINA is out of the cuffs. THE BAT-M surprised, looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handcuffs? What were you thinking? I'm a handcuff expert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for her but she's already slipped out the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA rolls in the ditch at THE BAT-MOBILE skids to a st few hundred feet up the road. SELINA takes off into the woods. She runs through with a natural animal grace, leaping fal trees, ducking branches, moving silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up SELINA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA spins around looking for the source of the voice. Then breaks into a serious sprint. She runs all out through the woods, leaps a stream, scram an embankment, then out into a clearing. She's really mov when В—

dialogues.speaker: SMASH
dialogues.text: В— she's tackled by THE BAT-MAN. He pins her down in the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't really think you could run from me, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles. Takes a swipe with her claws but he's read for her and easily dodges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking you in. I will not allow murder, not even for revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, slow down. (starts to have fun with the situation) I didn't kill that bastard, (shows her fingernails) I just prettied him up a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his gloved hand off her shoulder and admires th bat-shaped brass knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing you haven't done. (pouts, smiles) I'm innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hit the... GARAGE MECHANIC.  The cop is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed) I didn't kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deflates) Then it was the GARAGE MECHANIC?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head, pities him) No. CHI-CHI came in as I was marking CAMPBELL. HE killed him. Said the scumbag cop had taken enough of his money. He was going to kill me too. (sighs) He had me pinned, was trying to cut my wrists with that switchblade of his. Wanted it to look like murder suicide. But HOLLY showed up. We fought. (gestures to her cheek) I gave him a nice little something to remember me by and got the hell out of there.  I figured you could take care of yourself (beat) GARAGE-BOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) How did you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling, in my whole life, I've only met one REAL man. I'm not about to forget his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She draws the leather-gloved hand to her mouth and bites finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to knock me out again are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA pulls off his glove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mangled LINCOLN pulls to the curb on an empty street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have this bad feeling that the only way I'm ever going to see you again is if I continue my life of crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't recommend that. You didn't do so well on your debut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets out) Yeah, well, practice makes perfect, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds the pillowcase) Aren't you forgetting something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it  There's something in there I think you'll find interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks off shaking her money-maker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE's apartment is now jam-packed with crime fighting equipment. He reads GORDON'S FILES intently at his crampe desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds the pillowcase) Doing some redecorating? Funny, I never had you pegged as a satin pillow type of guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE reads a paper and puts it into a home-made photo machine. Pop goes a flash and out slips a microfilm, he a it to a little pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted, reading another) This changes everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you can take a break from your homework for a minute, I've got something to show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL jerks the plug on BRUCE's machine. BRUCE looks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL is again looking around in BIG AL's desk. After some searching he retrieves another key. It fits a door a the far end of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL leads BRUCE through the door and to a dark and dusty stairwell winding down into the В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL throws a heavy Frankenstein-style switch floodi an immense brick chamber with light. From the high, arched ceiling hang bare bulbs, tangled pi winches and chains. Industrial lathes, drills and presses line the walls. All covered in dust. The terminus of a rusted train track lies on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIG AL bought this place form the Wayne Corporation. Used to be a repair shop for the trains. Back in the day, Wayne Corp built a lot of the infrastructure for Gotham CityВ— water systems, electrical, sewers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE walks around, soaking it all in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place connects to the access tunnels. It's like a maze back in there. Runs all under the entire city. It's kind of spooky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE turns to look at LITTLE AL. BLOWN AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I thought you might like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rat squeaks by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOEB berates GORDON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!  I tell you to do one simple thing, catch some freak in tights. What's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOEB wears a hat to cover his burnt hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA sits amidst a pile of leather and sewing materials She snaps razor blades with a pair of pliers making littl triangles. Then, she sinks one of the small, metal triang into some kind of epoxy under her fingernail. SELINA holds her hand up to HOLLY В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - razors line the underside of each fingernail. HOLLY is horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hunt for THE BAT-MAN has been kicked into high gear. GORDON has,a dozen cops working with him now. His cramped office has been replaced with a full-sized situation room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have a spot set for tonight, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts down some papers) Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON consults a map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A well dressed MAN, WOMAN and a SMALL BOY walk hand-in-ha through a bad part of town. A thug follows them. THE BAT-MAN watches from a nearby rooftop.  But he does nothing as the man gets closer and pulls out a gun. THE BAT-MAN watches the guy grab the woman's purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Help! My purse!  Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still THE BAT-MAN does nothing. The mugger wrenches the purse free and takes off running the empty street. Watching from В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON jabs out a MARLBORO, frustrated В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, meet back at headquarters in 30 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - lights another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up and down the street homeless people shuffle out from behind dumpsters, get in unmarked cop cars and drive off. The couple and child head for a car. GORDON stops to than them. He squats down, tussles the SMALL BOY'S hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pair take off. GORDON, alone now, walks back to his c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can help you get what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON freezes. Turns slowly. THE BAT-MAN stands hidden in shadows just inside the alle GORDON puts his hands out like he's trying to calm a lost kitten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. We can talk. How about down at the station?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (easing his gun out) You know you're on a suicide course, right? I'll get you some help. They'll kill you otherwise. Believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Don't. It doesn't have to be like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON, facing THE BAT-MAN now, close, has his gun levele THE BAT-MAN'S chest. GORDON goes for his cuffs. THE BAT-MAN slaps the gun out his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fool. You idiot.  Don't you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOW!

dialogues.speaker: A TRAP WITHIN A TRAP
dialogues.text: Four uniform cops come out of hiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze! Put your hands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN looks over, then pounces on GORDON. His hands FUMBLE AROUND ON GORDON'S JACKET. As the cops move to encircle him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into a radio) We've got THE BAT-MAN at TRAP LOCATION ALPHA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN finally heaves GORDON through the air at the cops. He lands, head first, sprawling into the cops and knocking about half of them off their feet. THE BAT-MAN makes a break for it. Cops open fire В— BAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (only half conscious) HOLD YOUR FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN takes a slug in the thigh but makes it into a ABANDONED tenement. The cops come to GORDON'S side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, are you all right? Why didn't you give the signal sooner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubs his bleeding head) I had to be sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The UNIFORMED COPS help GORDON to his feet.  His head is bleeding badly. Cruisers start to show up. MERKEL arrives with an UNIFORM COP. Together they begin sealing off the area. FLASS pulls up and gets out of his car waving at the SWAT park by the ABANDONED TENNEMENT. An ambulance driver tries to tend to GORDON'S injuries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON is more concerned about the SWAT VAN unloading men

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my collar, my case. I'm in charge here. We DO NOT need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you can talk to Commissioner Loeb about that, Gordon. Here he comes now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT COMMANDER points to a POLICE HELICOPTER on the horiz From this distance you can just make out the fire bombs hanging below it like lures on a fishing line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN is in the LOBBY of what was once a transient hotel  He collapses against the check-in counter.  He wra duct tape around the badly bleeding wound in his thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN gets up. Trying the leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignore the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He limps up the stairs as fast as his injured leg will al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commissioner LOEB yells at the CHOPPER PILOT -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it, drop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we need clearance. There may be people in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one is in there but that psycho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOEB reaches over and slaps a button labeled "Incendiary Release".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sits back) I'll take full responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below the POLICE HELICOPTER, a dark object falls В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN bursts onto the roof and looks up at the fall bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN throws himself back inside and leaps the rail FOOM! В— the fire bomb goes off behind him. THE BAT-MAN falls just ahead of debris from the explosion hits the floor, HARD, and rolls under the staircase as ha the building collapses around him. He's bleeding badly, partially blind, groggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pass out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN removes a syringe, labelled "stimulant", from ammo belt and injects the needle into his biceps. His eyes come alive again: GRIM DETERMINATION. Everything is on fire. THE BAT-MAN wraps himself with his cape. The building threatens to come down around him. Dying homeless people scream in the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't help them. Must find shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN breaths through his cape as he crosses the lo to a STEEL DOOR bearing the words "Danger! 20,000 volts".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steel door, might be enough to protect me. Provided the warning is a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks the lock and slips through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POLICE HELICOPTER lands. LOEB gets out looking pretty pleased with himself. He slaps FLASS on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That building wasn't cleared. You hear that? That's the sound of people DYING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screams emanate from the building. Its upper floors are completely consumed in flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess that's the cost of doing business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON is about to take a swing at LOEB but MERKEL steps between the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you're bleeding pretty bad. Let's get your head looked at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushes around MERKEL) Later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds him) NOW! (beat) Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MERKEL looks at LOEB with disdain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to do anything RASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, time for you to go Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then a section of the roof collapses. Sparks fill th night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (together) Oooh. Aaaah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON, disgusted, leaves LOEB and FLASS to watch the fir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire trucks shower the now smoldering building with water the SWAT team goes in to search for survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smoke has settled a little bit. SWAT COMMANDER and his SWAT TEAM enters the half-collapse building as a well-oiled machine, covering each other and moving as a single, disciplined organism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No prisoners, Commissioner's orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT TEAM enters the lobby. The top floors have colla down the staircase filling the area with rubble. The elev shaft is piled with debris. Water pours from the ceiling. The SWAT TEAM finds the STEEL DOOR. They toss in CONCUSSI

dialogues.speaker: GRENADES
dialogues.text: Sections of the LOBBY floor jump, then sag and splinter f the explosions. Creaking sounds fill the LOBBY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is barely standing, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. SQUAD ONE, stay here. SQUAD TWO, with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT COMMANDER and SQUAD TWO go below to the В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grenades have destroyed the superintendent's basement apartment and blown a hole through the ceiling over his S BATHROOM. The puzzled men look around. Then SWAT GUY #1 points to t collapsed chimney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must have kicked through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoking gas canisters В— CLINK, CLINK В— fall out a hole chimney. INT. ABANDONED TENNEMENT. LOBBY - NIGHT. Upstairs, in the LOBBY, the crumbling brick above a firep explodes, showering SQUAD ONE. THE BAT-MAN pounces from his hiding place in the chimney

dialogues.speaker: SMACK
dialogues.text: В— he savages the armored men. The cramped basement apartment is filling with smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas  masks! Cough, cough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men fumble for their masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All around the lobby lies SQUAD ONE, unconscious. THE BAT kicks the steel door shut and RE-CLASPS THE LOCK, then cl over the debris and up the elevator shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police have barricaded the area with cars, ambulances fire trucks and situation vans. Helicopters circle overhe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SQUAD TWO opens fire at the lock on the STEEL DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reinforced ELEVATOR SHAFT rises a few feet above the debris of the top floors. Crouched in the shadows, THE BA scopes out the snipers and choppers with binoculars. PE-ANG! В— a sniper's bullet ricochets off brick near his face. THE BAT-MAN ducks and pulls a very detailed UNDERGROUND M from his ammo belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT COMMANDER kicks the steel door open, rips off his ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His men look at him in confusion. Half of them writhe on floor, bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get these men out of here. (Listens to radio) Snipers got him in the elevator shaft. (points) You two cover the shaft. You, over there. You, come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT TEAM takes up positions in the lobby as the woun men are dragged from the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON watches the scene outside the building while  paramedics work on the wounds THE BAT-MAN inflicted. SWAT GUYS approach GORDON'S ambulance, one carries the ot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let this man die, I'll have your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of paramedics get to work on the unconscious man

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an animal В— a wild beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The medics finish with GORDON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've given you about 35 stitches for that gash on your head. Try to keep it dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The medic hands back GORDON'S jacket. Something has been stuffed in his breast pocket. Puzzled, GORDON finds BRUCE microfilm. Holding it up to the light, his jaw drops open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be a son of a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, FLASS observes GORDON'S discovery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT TEAM waits nervously holding their machine guns the elevator shaft. Sweat beads on their foreheads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gloved hand drops a single brick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous SWAT GUYS open fire into the rubble. THE BAT-MAN uses the noise and confusion to drop through hole in the ceiling, unseen, onto a SWAT GUY. He pulls ba the SWAT GUY's helmet and sprays him with mace. A second SWAT GUY turns to fire but THE BAT-MAN throws hi knife into the guy's shoulder. He goes down screaming. The whole SWAT TEAM, now aware of THE BAT-MAN, turns and opens fire at the moving cape as it streaks across the LO Bullets tear through the cape and into old, brass mailbox THE BAT-MAN throws himself through the hole where the flo has collapsed and lands in a pile of shattered tile and mirror. He digs into his belt and pulls out several ROUND OBJECTS strung together with green cord. Then, holding one end of cord, he flushes them down TOILET. Upstairs, the SWAT TEAM, guns poised, peeks over the lip the broken ceiling just in time to get a face full of В— - exploding plumbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the BATHROOM door, THE BAT-MAN covers his ears un the debris settles. Then he's back into the BATHROOM peering into the giant h where the TOILET used to be. He gets on his hands and kne and squirms into the wet, slimy hole. A half second later SWAT COMMANDER and three SWAT GUYS sh up to investigate the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, it stinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shine their lights into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashlight beams shine through a hole in a long drain pip The light reflects off the water and feces-slimed walls a dark figure runs limping away down the pipe. A couple minutes later В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON watches as the sooty and defeated SWAT team exits building. LOEB screams at the SWAT COMMANDER. Spittle flies. Finger jab his chest. GORDON smiles as he the microfilm in his pocket and start his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the crime fighting equipment from BRUCE's room is now downstairs on several long workbenches. Up on a giant hydraulic lift the LINCOLN shows its scars earlier В— BULLET HOLES, BROKEN WINDOWS, CRUSHED FRONT EN LITTLE AL looks up to see a thoroughly shredded BAT-MAN a the tunnel entrance to the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN braces himself against the wall, fighting to on LITTLE AL grabs him before he falls and brings him to a workbench covered with medical equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off with your friends again I see. When are you going to learn to play nice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE winces as LITTLE AL cleans his wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go. I'm not done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE AL watches BRUCE try to get up. He can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight, son. You need time to heal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE tries again but can't even get off the bench. He collapses back, resigned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON and DENT smoke and drink at a back booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He risked his life to get me those files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could have mailed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really his style.  I think he read my files and wanted to be friends, allies, I don't know. He's obviously crazy but he's not the wild animal I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was more in those files than just my report В— evidence Harvey, it's all laid out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of evidence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON looks at his friend, savoring the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the JACKPOT. It corroborates everything we suspected. Loeb is in bed with the biggest names in Gotham underworld В— and we've got his accounting books. It's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could never be admissible in court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably not. At least not all of it. But there should be enough to get ESTRADA at least. And who knows, if we play our cards right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) It's dangerous, Jim. Who knows what they would do if they knew you had those files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the thing, no one knows. THE BAT-MAN slipped them to me in front of a half dozen officers. No one saw a thing, it was like a reverse pick pocketing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we can make this work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON lights a MARLBORO and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON, DENT and a dozen uniformed officers crowd the fro stoop and sidewalk. At the front door, ESTRADA, in a bathrobe, holds a subpoena. A dozen half-naked men and wo stand behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
