dialogues.text: Is this a bad time for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to speak with a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON cuffs ESTRADA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE, wrapped in numerous bandages, works on a black motorcycle His HEAD IS SHAVED and crisscrossed with STITCHES. He's i bad shape. Even turning a wrench causes pain. In the background on TV -

dialogues.speaker: CHANNEL ONE EYEWITNESS NEWS
dialogues.text: - local TV news shows a red faced LOEB push through a mob reporters to get into his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: District Attorney Harvey Dent today announced the arrest and indictment of Carlos ESTRADA on numerous racketeering charges В— the commissioner was unavailable for comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV shows GORDON leading ESTRADA up the steps of the Justice Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumors fly about high level police involvement and possible federal investigations. Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV shows BRUCE'S parents and a YOUNG BRUCE WAYNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Jim. Up next, it's been fifteen years since the tragic death of THOMAS WAYNE and the mysterious disappearance of the heir to the Wayne fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV shows old pictures of the GRAND THEATER as a crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go inside Wayne Corporation as it continues its agonizing search for young Bruce Wayne and see if we can't discover what has become of this fortunate young man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE's greasy hand slips off the wrench. It clanks acros the concrete floor to LITTLE AL's feet. LITTLE AL stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not. That little boy is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can't just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts) What? WALK away? Do I LOOK like I'm walking away from anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE gets to his feet and open a locker containing his s and equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making the most my inheritance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, painfully he pulls on his suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN guns his motorcycle through shallow puddles. scurry. He stops to check a map. A train rattles past behind a st grate separating his tunnel from the subway. He gets off the bike carrying a crow bar. He picks his ta and SMACKS a grimy junction box with it. The lid clanks t the ground exposing an dense tangle of PHONE WIRES. From a saddlebag he removes a TELEPHONE HEADSET. It has alligator clips where the phone should be. He pulls back his mask. He's still bleeding from his woun He cradles the phone to his ear and clips a pair of wires Listens. Clips another. Listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN tears out of the oversized sewer pipe on his motorcycle and bounces over debris clogging the bed of a stream. Homeless people recoil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark and quiet but something has woken up detective GORDON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loeb is up to something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON looks to the window where THE BAT-MAN forms a mass silhouette against the city nightscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warn Dent. It's going down tonight but I don't know what it is yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON, turns to get his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I know a way to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he turns back the window is empty, except for a smal puddle of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, Hon. I've got to go to work. That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON gets out of bed and fumbles for his gun.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GORDON'S CRAPPY CAR. EAST END
dialogues.text: GORDON cruises the street. Watching the nightlife. Lookin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the rundown warehouse district GORDON puts the car in and waits in the same spot as before. FLASS finally comes out of the low-slung drug lab and we catch a glimpse of a very white, clean room and some very dirty cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what are you cutting this stuff with? Makes me have to piss like a racehorse. Wait for CRAMDEN to get off the CAN and you could do yourself some SERIOUS INTERNAL DAMAGE.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ALLEY
dialogues.text: FLASS saunters to a DUMPSTER and proceeds to relieve hims

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try not to do DO any SERIOUS damage, Flass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASS WHIRLS, reaching for his PISTOL, BUT GORDON has the drop on FLASS, his GUN aimed, his hand steady as a surgeo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just enough to keep you out of the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASS tosses his GUN away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you gonna SHOOT me, Jiminy? Jiminy fricking CRICKET? You gonna SHOOT me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON slides his GUN back into its HOLSTER. In his other hand, GORDON casually swings the BLACK AND YELLOW BASEBAL BAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm not going to shoot you. You and me, we're going have a little ONE ON ONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON playfully slaps the BASEBALL BAT into his open han FLASS jerks a THUMB in the direction of the HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I give a SHOUT to the GUYS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then, I WILL shoot you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON WHIPS the BASEBALL BAT from hand to hand. Showing Pausing, calm as an executioner:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otherwise, it's ONE ON ONE. YOU and ME, Flass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One on one. Sure. I'll take you on, Jiminy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've gotta play fair. I hear you were a green beret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess you deserve a HANDICAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON tosses FLASS the BASEBALL BAT. He CATCHES it easily.  FLASS SWAGGERS, SWINGING the BAT f side to side. Belligerent. All grins:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be KIDDING. You going all KINKY on me, little man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready for your PUNISHMENT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIS is gonna HURT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure it is.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: GORDON SMASHES his FIST into FLASS' FACE, then DUCKS, as FLASS swings the BASEBALL BAT, missing by a mile -

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: GORDON delivers vicious blows to FLASS' midsection. THE BASEBALL BAT FLIES through the AIR, end over end. THEN, a SPINNING KICK sends FLASS sprawling. GORDON composes hims

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now then. Something's going down tonight, you're going to tell me what it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Forget it Gordon. You were in over your head, and now it's over В— IT'S ALREADY OVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Have it your way. I'd like to string you up. But when you took your shot at me, you told your friends to keep me out of the hospital. I suppose I should return the favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON turns to walk away, then spins around В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aww, FUCK it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В— and kicks the stricken, laughing FLASS in the ribs producing a sickening crunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally walking away) And Flass, thanks for showing me what it takes to be a cop in this town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now badly hurt) Be sure to say 'Hi' to ANN for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON instantly understands the full meaning of the thre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks into a run for his car, seconds later he's on t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is just a pink edge on the skyline as GORDON tear ass across town. He's taking horrible risks in traffic. POWER SLIDES THROUGH A CROWDED INTERSECTION В— commuters for the curb. BLOWS THROUGH A RED LIGHT В— delivery trucks honk and ski BUMPS OVER TRAIN TRACKS В— muffler sparks and tumbles loo He's on the radio В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need backup at 1827 Denny Way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SKIDS ONTO THE SIDEWALK В— В—crushes a MAILBOX into his apartment building and BOLTS the car into the front door, gun drawn. Meanwhile В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very pregnant and very hysterical ANN struggles with fo cops as they try to force her into an SUV. She's kicking screaming. CRYING. In the passenger seat sits a stoic LOEB smoking a cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody wanted it to be this way. I don't want to hurt anyone. It never had to go this far. Your husband just CANNOT take a hint. No matter how hard we BEAT it into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON bursts into the garage, gun drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your FILTHY HANDS off my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops go for their guns. GORDON can't shoot, ANN is to close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby get down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops OPEN FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: The shots echo in the garage. ANN throws herself down, as she's told.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: GORDON ducks for cover В— TOO LATE В—  HE'S HIT! The 9mm SLAMS into his stomach and BLOWS HIM OFF HIS FEET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh GOD, JIM!  BABY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he COMES UP SHOOTING

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: DOUBLE HEAD SHOT В— blood sprays, one down В—

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: TWO CHEST SHOTS В— a second cop staggers back, stricken a shocked В—

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: ONE IN THE HIP В— third cop spins, but manages to keep hi feet, until В— BLAM! STOMACH SHOT В— he crumples. The surviving cop, with the help of LOEB, manages to stuf the pregnant ANN into the SUV. The last COP punches the gas and shoots for the door but BAT-MAN standsВ— BLOCKING THE EXIT В— in front of his bla motorcycle. The truck ACCELERATES - HE'S GOING TO CRASH THROUGH. Instead of getting out of the way, THE BAT-MAN VAULTS OVE THE HOOD as the SUV crushes the motorcycle. HE SMASHES fe first through the windshield, DRIVING both SPIKED BOOTS i the driver's face.  The SUV careens WILDLY, CRASHES into a parked car and ROL OVER AND BACK ONTO ITS WHEELS. Everything goes momentarily black. Light returns and we find ourselves -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOEB pulls ANN down the street by her hair. He's bleeding badly from a huge gash on his forehead and seems a little dazed. BRUCE falls from the SUV's door onto the sidewalk amid a shower of shattered safety glass. His disguise hangs shredded. HIS MASK IS GONE. He tries to get his feet but STUMBLES AND FALLS, tries ag and rises VERY UNSTEADILY. HE'S NEAR THE END. GORDON pulls himself across the street by sheer force of will. He bleeds all over the place from his gut wound. His gun, SLIPPERY FROM BLOOD, is hard to hold. Together BRUCE and GORDON converge on LOEB who seems to b least damaged of the three and now holds a MAGNUM in his hand. LOEB stops, turns and fires at his pursuers

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: They throw themselves behind parked cars. Glass rains down.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: From their positions behind parked cars, GORDON and THE B MAN make eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striking terror, what else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean the sun's coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we better hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up his service revolver) I'm out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN draws a nasty looking THROWING KNIFE from his boot. GORDON nods. Both men stand at the same time to face LOEB who holds hi gun on one, then the other, momentarily unsure of what to THE BAT-MAN pinches the knife by its tip, ready to throw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don' t make me do it. Let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's holding ANN in front of himself as a human shield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't do it. YOU DON'T KILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (levels his empty gun) I have no such reservations Loeb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PFFT. You're empty. If you had a shot, I'd be dead by now. I WALK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOEB has made it to -  EXT. ENTRANCE TO AN URBAN PARK. GORDON grows irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAKE him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to GORDON) She's too close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to THE BAT-MAN) You've got nothing.  I've seen your face. I've got the woman. And you won't kill me, it's against your code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it!

dialogues.speaker: THE KNIFE SINKS DEEP INTO LOEB'S EYE.
dialogues.text: He SCREAMS and falls writhing on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a lot of codes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN runs over to her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to LOEB) Here's a little something to remember me by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN, huddled over the supine LOEB, does В— someth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh JIM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls away) You've been shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It went right through.  I'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON staggers a little.  He's weak from his wounds. THE MAN steadies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to THE BAT-MAN) Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look kind of hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right. He looks as if he's had a burning building dropped on him. He's scarred, cut, bleeding and bruised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be all right В— (beat) - with a little help from my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And WHO ARE your friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, who are YOU?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a COP. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm THE BAT-MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON points to LOEB, his cheek carved with a letter "Z"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't look like the mark of the bat. What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a gift for a kid I used to know, a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Sirens coming, you better go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so you know, I'm practically blind without my glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAT-MAN, tosses the glasses from across the street В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you around, DETECTIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В— just as a truck drives in between them. It looks like AL and Son's Garage TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, (realizing he's gone) BATMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cop cars, ambulances and TV crews show up we В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotham's skyline fills our vision as we zoom in on the to floor of a super-ritzy high-rise.  Its floor-to-ceiling windows open onto a wrap-around, STONE ROOF-DECK. We continue through into a splendid modern LIVING ROOM. P leather sofas are sunk into the floor to create a GLAMORO ENTERTAINMENT CENTER.  Built into the wall is a GIANT-SCR TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a bizarre shooting incident early this morning Gotham's Hero Cop James Gordon thwarted an attempted kidnapping of his pregnant wife by a band of ROGUE POLICE OFFICERS. Following the melee, three police officers are dead and two others hospitalized, including Police Commissioner Gillian Loeb who was BLINDED and DISFIGURED during the confrontation. GORDON was admitted to MERCY GENERAL for gunshot wounds. He is expected to make a complete recovery, as is his wife, ANN, and the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds of breaking glass fill the luxurious penthouse the report continues В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This evening, Police Commissioner Loeb faces numerous criminal charges including kidnapping and allegations of collusion with organized crime. Further reports indicated that Detective Jonathan Flass, also hospitalized at this hour in an unrelated incident, will turn state's witness against Loeb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone has entered the LIVING ROOM. Their silhouette tip past the TV, while В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAYOR NOONE has been unavailable for comment and seems unlikely to face charges at this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mysterious intruder lifts an EXQUISITE OIL PAINTING o the wall as we В—

dialogues.speaker: EXT OVERGROWN GARDEN
dialogues.text: BRUCE WAYNE stands in a vast, classical garden amid weeds tall grass. Flickering firelight illuminates his face in gathering gloom of night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECEMBER 18. Dear Father, you have taught me well, showed me who I am and what it takes to be a man in this world. For that I am grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE looks down at his CARDBOARD SHIPPING BOX full of letters burning in a brick fire pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am ready to find my own way now. I will make the most of my inheritance. And I will always honor your memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE holds a final letter in his hands. He looks at it f one more moment, then lets it slip into the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night is falling. I've got work to do. Your loving son, (beat) BATMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE wipes away a tear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bruce!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE turns to see LITTLE AL burst out the back patio doo a fabulous, old-world mansion. Warm, inviting light shine through the living room windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is SWEET!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE smiles as he heads into his home. We pull back and away as the voice of a news anchor trick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other news, missing millionaire heir to the Wayne Enterprises fortune, Bruce WAYNE, has returned to Gotham City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull up, out and over the front gate of Bruce's home. Secured into the solid, timeless stone is an iron plaque. reads: WAYNE MANOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the GLAMOROUS ENTERTAINMENT CENTER, we pull back from GIANT-SCREEN TV as the news continues В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the tragic murder of his parents more than 15 years ago, young BRUCE seemingly disappeared. Well, it turns out he was safe and sound all along pursuing his education abroad at the finest schools in Europe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're wide enough now to see SELINA working on a wall saf The EXQUISITE OIL PAINTING rests against the wall at her feet. She's wearing a sexy, black leather CAT-BURGLAR SUIT comp with ears, claws and a tail. A whip hangs on her hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what a handsome young man he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA's head snaps around to see BRUCE on the TV waving well-wishers at the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out ladies. Gotham has a new most eligible bachelor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA saunters over to the TV. Smiles ear-to-ear licks l and В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plot thickens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В— blows a kiss to BRUCE on the TV. Then, holding up a remote control device, she pushes a re button В—

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: - the wall safe blows. Casually, The CATWOMAN scoops out a glorious DIAMOND NECK and clasps it around her neck. Suddenly an alarm sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles. Then runs full speed for the STONE ROOF-DECK leaps over the railing. For just a moment she hangs in th air, high above the glittering lights of Gotham City. Then she's gone. FADE OUT. CREDITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
